job_text: ['', 'Technical Capabilities', 'Qualifications', 'Strategic thinker', 'The ideal candidate must be dynamic, passionate, self-motivated, confident in working with multiple stakeholders and comfortable in a matrix organization. They need to be able to gain the trust and confidence of the stakeholders across the organization and be a visible driver who can drive results through influencing the work of others.', 'Data & Applied Scientist', 'Strong listening skills', 'Strong communicator', 'Demonstrated ability to manage projects or programs including work prioritization, planning, and coordination.', 'Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders.', 'The ideal candidate must be dynamic, passionate, self-motivated, confident in working with multiple stakeholders and comfortable in a matrix organization. They need to be able to gain the trust and confidence of the stakeholders across the organization and be a visible driver who can drive results through influencing the work of others.Bachelor’s degree or higher, preferably in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Management information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or similar field.5+ years of hands-on experience with data science and analytics; tool design and building.Demonstrated ability to manage projects or programs including work prioritization, planning, and coordination.Solid communication and data presentation skills, experience analyzing data and communicating the results to business leaders.Ability to work cross-functionally, building and maintaining trust with internal stakeholders.', 'Bachelor’s degree or higher, preferably in an analytical area such as Computer Science, Management information Systems, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or similar field.', 'Strong collaboration skills/team player', '5+ years of hands-on experience with data science and analytics; tool design and building.', 'Responsibilities', 'Solid communication and data presentation skills, experience analyzing data and communicating the results to business leaders.']

['', 'Key Roles and Responsibilities:', 'Proficiency with SQL required', 'Knowledge of statistics, specifically experimental design and analysis', ' The hustle of a startup with the impact of a global business', 'Scripting skills, preferably in Python. Strong Python/NumPy/PANDAS skills a plus', ' Working with an outstanding team of creative, fun and highly motivated people', 'Integrate captured event data with other sources of customer data, such as surveys, ad publishers and app store data', 'Build models to better understand the value and churn behavior of our users', 'Perform ongoing ad-hoc analyses to evaluate the efficiency of our marketing spend, building reporting infrastructure, and assisting in making budgeting recommendations to optimize growth', 'Skills Required:', 'Support reporting and business intelligence needs of the entire Marketing team.', 'Ability to build constructive and effective relationships with a broad and diverse group of business partners', 'Find the “story” in the data and communicate insights and opportunities with executive and other internal teams', 'Familiarity with common KPIs, metrics, and growth experiments', 'Ability to think objectively and interpret meaningful themes from quantitative and qualitative data', 'Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint', 'As part of our team, you’ll enjoy:', '3+ years of relevant experience', 'Master and own the analytical understanding of customer behavior and business performance ', ' Tremendous opportunity to seek some of the industry’s most exciting problems', 'Ability to execute on complex analytics projects where you have to determine salient questions in a complex ecosystem and present action-oriented conclusions', ' Comprehensive health coverage, competitive salary, and 401(k) match']

['', 'Experience with leveraging best practices conducting advanced analytics projects', 'You will work with a diverse set of Optum researchers, clinicians, internal and external clients to define the projects and see them through to completion that cover a range of clinical focus.', 'Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity / Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.', 'All Telecommuters will be required to adhere to UnitedHealth Group’s Telecommuter Policy.', 'Primary Responsibilities', '3+ years of experience as a hands-on data scientist, non-managerial role and executing on data science, analytics, or programming projects', '1+ years of experience in machine learning, statistics, predictive modeling, research analytics, natural language processing, or other AI subdomains and techniques ', 'UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.', ' Experience in Python (can be combination of academic and professional) Experience with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Spark Experience in Biostatistics or related field Experience with SQL or relational databases Familiarity with EHR data and standards ', 'If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders.', 'Experience with open-source distributed data processing frameworks, such as Spark', 'Specifically, as a member of our collaborative team you will be working with structured and unstructured data to explore the data, develop models, and performing research analytics. I', 'Required Qualifications', ' 3+ years of experience as a hands-on data scientist, non-managerial role and executing on data science, analytics, or programming projects 1+ years of experience in machine learning, statistics, predictive modeling, research analytics, natural language processing, or other AI subdomains and techniques  Experience with Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or spaCy Experience with leveraging best practices conducting advanced analytics projects If you need to enter a work site for any reason, you will be required to screen for symptoms using the ProtectWell mobile app, Interactive Voice Response (i.e., entering your symptoms via phone system) or a similar UnitedHealth Group-approved symptom screener. When in a UnitedHealth Group building, employees are required to wear a mask in common areas. In addition, employees must comply with any state and local masking orders. ', 'Careers with Optum. ', 'We are looking for a data scientist who is eager to tackle the challenges of extracting insights from vast amounts of EHR data originating from multiple sources. ', 'Experience with Pandas, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or spaCy', 'Familiarity with EHR data and standards', "your life's best work.(sm)", 'Experience in Python (can be combination of academic and professional)', 'You would be participating in the development of our end-to-end NLP pipeline, building descriptive and predictive analytics and producing research validations.', 'Experience in Biostatistics or related field', 'If you have the experience, curiosity and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle these challenges, we want to talk to you.', ' We are looking for a data scientist who is eager to tackle the challenges of extracting insights from vast amounts of EHR data originating from multiple sources.  You will work with a diverse set of Optum researchers, clinicians, internal and external clients to define the projects and see them through to completion that cover a range of clinical focus. You would be participating in the development of our end-to-end NLP pipeline, building descriptive and predictive analytics and producing research validations. Specifically, as a member of our collaborative team you will be working with structured and unstructured data to explore the data, develop models, and performing research analytics. I If you have the experience, curiosity and entrepreneurial spirit to tackle these challenges, we want to talk to you. ', 'Preferred Qualifications', 'Experience with SQL or relational databases']

['', 'Design predictive models which grow and adapt as our products and customer base scale, utilizing machine learning, time-series and Bayesian statistics', 'Make rigorous statistical inferences from A/B testing on our product and customer segments', 'Passion to use all aspects of data science, programming, and technology to build the financial advisor of the future', 'Data Engineering and ETL experience is a big plus!', 'Knowledge of Looker or similar front end analytics platforms', 'MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or a related field with 3+ years of experience', 'Comfort with distributed computing, specifically Pyspark, AWS EMR, and Airflow', 'Build and maintain scalable data systems and infrastructure that empower our marketing, product and business teams to make better decisions\xa0Design predictive models which grow and adapt as our products and customer base scale, utilizing machine learning, time-series and Bayesian statisticsWork with large datasets to help us better understand our customers and anticipate their needs through distributed computation techniquesMake rigorous statistical inferences from A/B testing on our product and customer segmentsNormalize our data across institutions and sources using semi-supervised learning', 'Stash is looking for a Data Scientist with a passion for building reliable, scalable, and performant data systems and software. We look for strategic thinkers and creative problem solvers with a bias for execution and we’ll expect you to contribute code as well as product/feature ideas from the get-go. If you are looking for a culture that encourages ownership, taking calculated risks, being data-driven and that values evidence over ego, this may be the role for you.', 'Who we’re looking for:', 'What you’ll do:', 'Work with large datasets to help us better understand our customers and anticipate their needs through distributed computation techniques', 'Experience using machine learning to improve algorithmic systems', 'Build and maintain scalable data systems and infrastructure that empower our marketing, product and business teams to make better decisions\xa0', 'An understanding of storing and querying data from Redshift, PostgreSQL, or similar database infrastructures', 'Normalize our data across institutions and sources using semi-supervised learning', 'MS in Computer Science, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Physics, Engineering or a related field with 3+ years of experience2+ years of professional programming work in Python, Scala, Java, or similarExperience with Pandas, R, or other statistical modeling frameworksAn understanding of storing and querying data from Redshift, PostgreSQL, or similar database infrastructuresPassion to use all aspects of data science, programming, and technology to build the financial advisor of the futureExperience using machine learning to improve algorithmic systemsComfort with distributed computing, specifically Pyspark, AWS EMR, and AirflowKnowledge of Looker or similar front end analytics platformsData Engineering and ETL experience is a big plus!', '2+ years of professional programming work in Python, Scala, Java, or similar', 'Experience with Pandas, R, or other statistical modeling frameworks', 'Stash is investing, simplified. We are a financial platform that makes it easy for anyone to start with as little as $5. Through education and guidance, we help investors learn the basics so they can confidently save and invest for themselves. At Stash, we are working toward a future where investors are as diverse as our world.\xa0']

['', 'What You’ll Like About Us', 'You have a superior knowledge of statistical analysis methods, such as input selection, logistic and standard regression, etc.', 'We base our work on scientifically-proven, peer-reviewed methodologies that are designed by medical professionals.', 'You possess excellent SQL/relational algebra skills, ideally with at least a basic knowledge of how different types of databases (e.g.: column vs row storage) work.', ' We work on problems that affect the lives of real people. Our users depend on us to make positive changes to their health and their lives. We base our work on scientifically-proven, peer-reviewed methodologies that are designed by medical professionals. We are a data-driven company through and through. We’re a respectful, diverse, and dynamic environment in which Engineering is a first-class citizen, and where you’ll be able to work on a variety of interesting problems that affect the lives of real people. We offer a generous budget for personal development expenses like training courses, conferences, and books. You’ll get three weeks’ paid vacation and a flexible work policy that is remote- and family-friendly (about 50% of our engineering team is fully remote). We worry about results, not time spent in seats. ', 'You have 4+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or Data Analyst in a similarly-sized organization, with a proven record of analysis and research that positively impacts your team.', 'We offer a generous budget for personal development expenses like training courses, conferences, and books.', 'You are comfortable with at least “medium data” technologies and how to transcend the “memory bound” nature of most analytics tools.', 'We work on problems that affect the lives of real people. You possess excellent communication skills and the ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience You possess excellent SQL/relational algebra skills, ideally with at least a basic knowledge of how different types of databases (e.g.: column vs row storage) work. You have a superior knowledge of statistical analysis methods, such as input selection, logistic and standard regression, etc. You are comfortable writing Python code, and have good working knowledge of pandas and numpy. TRADOC G-2 is the designated Lead for Core Function #13 Operational Environment; the process of developing, verifying, validating, accrediting, and providing OE products and services represents an authoritative, validated OE contextual baseline for TRADOC users and operational forces in the areas of training and training development; education; leader development; concept and doctrine development; and capabilities development, integration, and evaluation.', 'Verifiable, active SECRET security clearance (or the ability and willingness to quickly obtain one)', 'Looking for candidates from Virginia or Noth Carolina.', '· 5 years of experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models', '· Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision tree learning, artificial neural networks, etc.) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.', '· Mine and analyze data from existing databases to drive decision making.', '· Use predictive modeling.', 'o Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.', '· Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.', '· Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.', '· Excellent written and verbal communication skills for coordinating across teams.', '· Coordinate with different functional teams to implement models and monitor outcomes.', 'o Experience querying databases and using statistical computer languages: R, Python, etc.', 'o Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders', 'Morton is seeking a highly qualified Technical PD – Data Scientist to provide professional services and support for a key client working with the TRADOC Deputy Chief of Staff for Intelligence (G-2) Operational Environment (OE) and Core Functions. The Operational Environment (OE) is a composite of the conditions, circumstances, and influences that affect the employment of military forces and bear on the decisions of the unit commander. As an organic, complex system, the OE provides the common framework in which warfighting programs and strategies are conceived, defined, and executed. It is a living foundation in which choices made, by adversary and allies alike, affect the outcome of the future which must be accounted for. As adversary’s asymmetrical approach to warfare continues to generate greater complexity and flexibility, the government’s requirement for similar complexity and adaptability in Tactics, Techniques and Procedures (TTPs) escalates correspondingly.', '· Work with Government stakeholders to identify opportunities for leveraging data to drive data driven decision making.', '· A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques', '· Must be a U.S. citizen', '· Verifiable, active SECRET security clearance (or the ability and willingness to quickly obtain one)', 'Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:', '· Work with large data sets to better understand the changing worldwide geopolitical and tactical level military landscape. Use a variety of data mining/data analysis methods and data tools to build and implement models, using/creating algorithms and creating/running simulations.', '· Familiar with the following software/tools:', '· Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests and proper usage, etc.) and experience with applications.', 'o Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc.', 'Required Qualifications:', '· Bachelor’s Degree', '· Experience working with and creating data architectures.', '· Excellent organizational skills']

Promote AI/ML wherever applicable, beyond security use cases; Collaborate with data analytics team to define new platform requirements and continuously improve our horizontally scalable data lake. ['', 'Use large scale data processing frameworks such as Spark, AWS EMR for feature engineering and be proficient across various data both structured and un-structured.', 'Use Deep Learning models like CNN, RNN and NLP (BERT) for solving various business use cases like name entity resolution, forecasting and anomaly detection.', 'Location: Palo Alto, CA', 'Build and train production grade ML models on large-scale datasets to solve various business use cases for Commercial Banking.Use large scale data processing frameworks such as Spark, AWS EMR for feature engineering and be proficient across various data both structured and un-structured.Use Deep Learning models like CNN, RNN and NLP (BERT) for solving various business use cases like name entity resolution, forecasting and anomaly detection.Ability to build ML models across Public and Private clouds including container-based Kubernetes environments.Develop end-to-end ML pipelines necessary to transform existing applications and business processes into true AI systems.Build both batch and real-time model prediction pipelines with existing application and front-end integrations.You will collaborate to develop large-scale data modeling experiments, evaluating against strong baselines, and extracting key statistical insights and/or cause and effect relations.', 'The ideal candidate will have a strong knowledge of ML, NLP, Deep Learning, Knowledge Graphs and have experience working with massive amounts of data. ', ' Advanced degree (MSc or PhD) from a highly quantitative discipline, such as statistics, physics, computer science, electrical engineering, operations research etc.  Solid knowledge of statistics. Previous experience in applying statistical concepts in business / policy / research settings  Team player. Experience collaborating on code with other developers  Experience with healthcare data is a plus ', ' Experience with healthcare data is a plus ', ' Design and implement model features using administrative claims data, engagement data, and other data sources.  Build, maintain, monitor and improve predictive models, to identify good candidates for therapy and optimize the patient outreach process.  Collaboration: You will work with teams across the organization to both design and build data-driven solutions. For example, with our Clinical team, you will provide guidance on the size and structure of our therapist network, ensuring that we have sufficient supply to meet demand; with our Product team, you will use data-driven insights to design new product features for our platform.  High-Impact Focus: Our team receives a lot of requests for new analyses, processes, reports, etc. It is our job to prioritize these requests with our stakeholders and invest time in projects with the highest potential value-add for the organization. You will be actively involved in making these decisions. ', ' , ', 'This is a remote positionAbleTo is the leading provider of high quality, technology-enabled behavioral health care. AbleTo believes that everyone deserves access to high-quality care, and offers a suite of technology-enabled services to empower people to lead better lives through better mental health. A proprietary platform connects individuals with AbleTo highly trained licensed providers who deliver weekly sessions by phone or video supported by an integrated digital experience. Members also have access to mental health coaches, and digital support programs. Clinical best practices are leveraged across all services to ensure individuals are getting the care they need. Our outcomes-focused care is proven to improve depression and anxiety by over 50% on average, as demonstrated in several peer-reviewed studies. For patients with high-cost medical conditions, our clinically-tailored treatment is proven to reduce medical costs with care that empowers the patient to address their health needs. AbleTo partners with payers to make high-quality care accessible, affordable and convenient for millions of people to get the treatment they need.The Enterprise Analytics and Data Science (EADS) team plays a key role at AbleTo, with objectives including: 1) support company operations; 2) scale data knowledge across organization; 3) act as internal data consultants; 4) identify and run high-impact analyses.Under EADS, there are 3 highly collaborative work teams: 1) the data science team creates and improves predictive models to identify patients who could benefit from our programs; 2) the business insights team develops operational reports for different stakeholders to track company performance; 3) the advanced analytics team develops statistical studies to support business questions. And we work closely with the data engineering team who ingests data received from clients and implements new clients and new data sources.The Data Science team develops and deploys machine learning models to 1) identify patients who could benefit from our programs using medical claims data, 2) optimize provider network and call center workflows using operational data, and 3) build other data products as needed.As a Data Scientist At AbleTo, You Will Work In a Uniquely Cross-functional Capacity, Helping Teams Across The Organization Apply Analytical Rigor To Their Decision-making Design and implement model features using administrative claims data, engagement data, and other data sources.  Build, maintain, monitor and improve predictive models, to identify good candidates for therapy and optimize the patient outreach process.  Collaboration: You will work with teams across the organization to both design and build data-driven solutions. For example, with our Clinical team, you will provide guidance on the size and structure of our therapist network, ensuring that we have sufficient supply to meet demand; with our Product team, you will use data-driven insights to design new product features for our platform.  High-Impact Focus: Our team receives a lot of requests for new analyses, processes, reports, etc. It is our job to prioritize these requests with our stakeholders and invest time in projects with the highest potential value-add for the organization. You will be actively involved in making these decisions. AbleTo believes that everyone deserves access to high-quality care, and offers a suite of technology-enabled services to empower people to lead better lives through better mental health. A proprietary platform connects individuals with AbleTo highly trained licensed providers who deliver weekly sessions by phone or video supported by an integrated digital experience. Members also have access to mental health coaches, and digital support programs. Clinical best practices are leveraged across all services to ensure individuals are getting the care they need. Our outcomes-focused care is proven to improve depression and anxiety by over 50% on average, as demonstrated in several peer-reviewed studies. For patients with high-cost medical conditions, our clinically-tailored treatment is proven to reduce medical costs with care that empowers the patient to address their health needs. ['', 'Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management, Systems Engineering or equivalent field of study', 'Optimizes statistical efficiency and data quality in close collaboration with the production teams.', 'Provides the data analysis and be a key participant in the manufacturing problem solving process to ensure a fact based and data driven Root Cause analysis and Counter Measure identification.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Develops and implements data collection systems', 'Exciting opportunity to work for a global leader in the medical diagnostic manufacturing industry!\xa0We have an immediate opening for an experienced Process Data Scientist to join our growing team here in Branchburg, NJ.\xa0The Process Data Scientist provides data science support for Operations and turns data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions in close collaboration with Production Specialists. Use of experience, analytic approach and know how is crucial for identifying process improvements to ensure a stable manufacturing yield of our Manufacturing facilities. Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends and patterns in complex data sets. Key contributor in solving manufacturing problems and providing data analysis to make fact-based decisions. Works in a dynamic environment providing process improvements for Manufacturing Operations.', 'Education:\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0', "Develops and implements data collection systemsDevelops and monitor KPI's to support the production teams to strategically steer and continuously improve quality improvement initiatives.Optimizes statistical efficiency and data quality in close collaboration with the production teams.Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systemsIdentifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets to improve yield for production processes.Provides the data analysis and be a key participant in the manufacturing problem solving process to ensure a fact based and data driven Root Cause analysis and Counter Measure identification.Willingness to learn manufacturing technologies in a regulated production/operations environment.Other duties as assigned by management.", 'Acquires data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems', 'Identifies, analyzes, and interprets trends or patterns in complex data sets to improve yield for production processes.', 'Willingness to learn manufacturing technologies in a regulated production/operations environment.', "Develops and monitor KPI's to support the production teams to strategically steer and continuously improve quality improvement initiatives.", 'Other duties as assigned by management.', '\xa0', 'MS SQL, Python, Tableau, R, Statistical knowledge. Ability to be proactive and take responsibility for assigned technical areas Great Team Player', 'Skills/Technical skills: ', 'Interested candidates please apply with an up to date resume. Qualified candidates will be contacted within 24-48 hours of resume review.\xa0']

'Competitive salary, equity, and a robust benefits package includes top-notch medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, commuter benefits and we cover 95% of the cost of employee benefits and 65% of the cost of dependent care coverage!\xa0We also offer flexible PTO and some WFH opportunities as needed.', 'Research product workflow change or features that will improve detection and ensure optimal user experience\xa0', 'Competitive salary, equity, and a robust benefits package includes top-notch medical, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, commuter benefits and we cover 95% of the cost of employee benefits and 65% of the cost of dependent care coverage!\xa0', 'We are a fast-growing startup that is disrupting the fraud industry by putting the control back into the hands of digital businesses with an innovative approach that bankrupts the underlying business model of fraudsters. Our fraud and abuse prevention platform combines real-time intelligence, rich analytics and adaptive step-up challenges to progressively diminish the profitability of attacks while adapting to evolving attack patterns. We offer the only fraud solution with a 100% SLA guarantee. The world’s largest brands trust us to protect their customer journey while delivering unrivaled customer experience.', 'Experience working in the web security space is a plus (fraud, bot management, abuse, web application firewall)\xa0Background in cybersecurity or fraud\xa0Startup Experience', 'Research and develop new ML models as necessary to meet agreed upon product requirements and goals\xa0', 'The product platform organization is responsible for the overall fraud and abuse protection product strategy. The focus of the team is to define the product requirements, research the best way to defend against the threat vectors and architect the product to meet the following key requirements: Detection: Detect automated and human fraud / abuse through various methods with high accuracy. The detection must be tightly integrated with the challenge framework so as to adopt the most effective response strategy depending on the risk associated with the request session. The challenge framework is managed by Matt Ford’s Product Challenge organization. Visibility: provide a set of dashboard and reports to customers, partner and our support team to allow them to visualize and analyze the fraud activity detected by the product Serviceability: provide customers the ability tune the detection and response strategy based on the risk score. Also provide customers the ability to craft custom logic to meet their own requirements. The product platform consists of technical product managers and the product research team. The product research team is responsible for coming up with different ways to process data collected on a session in order to differentiate bot from human traffic but also detect human fraud within the human traffic. The team may use different techniques including but not limited to statistical model, unsupervised learning, supervised learning, deep learning, whichever model is the most effective to meet the accuracy requirements.', 'A Bachelor or Masters Degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent experience\xa0', 'Company Description:', 'Ability to adapt quickly and constructively to changes\xa0', 'Work with the Customer Success team to assist as needed with complex escalation, training on new detection methods and best practices for effectively defending against attacks\xa0', '\xa0', 'Previous experience in a ML or data scientist role and a track record of building ML or DL models\xa0', 'Evaluate accuracy of detection methods and propose enhancements as needed\xa0', 'Experience working in the web security space is a plus (fraud, bot management, abuse, web application firewall)\xa0', 'Work with the technical product manager team to review requirement and expected outcomes\xa0', 'We also offer flexible PTO and some WFH opportunities as needed.', 'General Requirements:', 'Ability to code, experiment and fail fast\xa0', 'Background in cybersecurity or fraud\xa0', "Example of this includes: user-agent deprecation and transition to client-hints Google privacy sandbox and privacy budget proposal, Safari's intelligent tracking prevention, Firefox enhanced tracking prevention\xa0", 'Get involved in customers calls on occasion to discuss future product directions\xa0', 'Required Skills: Machine Learning, Data Science, Deep Learning, Data Modeling, HTTP, DNS, HTML, JavaScript, JS, CSS, Python, R, SQL', 'Follow evolution of privacy features introduced by browser vendors, assess possible impact for the product and propose necessary adjustment as needed.\xa0']

['', 'PM20', "BioIntelliSense is ushering in a new era of continuous health monitoring and clinical intelligence for Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM) and Screening (COVID-19/Infection). Our medical-grade Data-as-a-Service (DaaS) platform seamlessly captures multi-parameter vital signs, physiological biometrics and symptomatic events through an effortless patient experience. The FDA-cleared BioSticker and BioButton devices make remote monitoring and early detection simple. Through the platform's advanced analytics, clinicians, patients, and employers will now have access to high-resolution patient trending and reporting to enable medical grade care at home, and medical grade screening in the office, school, or residence.", 'Duties:', '- Masters or Ph.D. helpful, but not required', 'Data Science Engineer', '- Running data science experiments at scale on Google Cloud infrastructure ', '- Mentoring junior members of team in technical areas', 'This is a unique opportunity to apply your experience, roll-up-your-sleeves and significantly contribute to the rapid development, growth and expansion of BioIntelliSense in delivering clinical intelligence, globally. ', ' sensor fusion algorithms', 'time-series sensor data', 'We are seeking a Data Science Engineer to help spearhead our catalogue of cloud-based BioSignatures for early detection and screening for various disease states and physiological deterioration.  ', 'Roles & Responsibilities:', '**BioIntelliSense is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, veteran, disability status or any other status protected under federal, state or local law.', '- Developing and reviewing system architecture to optimize the balance across cloud vs. edge processing. ', 'We are looking for top talent anywhere in the U.S.A, with a preference for the Denver, CO, or Northern California areas for a role that is work from home, with occasional travel to meet with the engineering team (once the pandemic is under control). ', '- BS in related field', 'The ideal candidate will have a mix of research with a solid track record of engineering execution with at least 7+ years of experience as a full-stack data scientist with Google Cloud or AWS expertise. Experience with time-series sensor data at scale along with sensor fusion algorithms background.', '- 7+ years of cloud-based data science or algorithm experience', '- Developing ML models from time-series sensor and bio-signal data', 'For more information on how BioIntelliSense is redefining remote patient monitoring through medical-grade and cost-effective data services, please contact us at info@biointellisense.com or visit our website at BioIntelliSense.com.', '- Being able to work under pressure in a startup environment', 'Minimum Experience, Skills, and Education:']

['', 'Preferred Qualifications: ', 'This position is responsible for business consulting activities for the Analytics Competency Center within various business units as the primary interface and as a liaison to Information Technology in order to: Serve as an expert in translating complex data into key strategy insights and valuable actions. Discover business narratives told by the data and present them to other scientists, business stakeholders, and managers at various levels. Develop and test heuristics. Create and run models. Perform data exploration and data mining. Create business intelligence, dashboards, visualizations, and/or other advanced analytics reports to adequately tell the business narrative and offer recommendations that are practiced, actionable, and have material impact, in addition to being well-supported by analytical models and data.\xa0', "Required Qualifications: Master's degree in business analytics or an advanced computer programming field, statistics, physics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, management of information systems, or related fields or an MBA. Work experience in addition to degree: 10+ years. Licenses, certifications or registrations: Certified Analytics Professional (CAP) from INFORMS. ", 'Contract to hire (12 months before conversion)', 'Job-specific knowledge, skills or abilities: Working knowledge of statistics, programming and predictive modeling. Working knowledge of code writing. Previous experience working in data mining or natural language processing. Possess advanced statistics/machine learning knowledge and implementation skills.\xa0', 'Preferred Qualifications: Strong critical thinking skills and the ability to relate them to the products or services the company is producing. Understanding of and ability to use programming languages like Python and SQL (Structured Query Language). Strong knowledge of basic and advanced prediction models. Data mining knowledge that spans a range of disciplines. Strong exploratory analysis skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as the ability to bridge the gap between data science and business management. Exceptional organizational skills and is detail oriented. Mastery of statistics, machine learning, algorithms and advanced mathematics.\xa0', 'Required Qualifications: ', 'No C2C', 'Job-specific knowledge, skills or abilities: ', 'Must be able to convert to a full time employee without sponsorship']

job_title: Lead Data Scientist (AI, ML, NLP, Image and/or Signal Processing)
job_text: ['Your Mission', '', ' Strong verbal and written communication; collaborative focus ', ' Ph.D. or Masters in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology or another quantitative field with strong foundation in healthcare technology and life sciences ', ' Consistently execute against a product roadmap to deliver multiple features ', ' Proven leadership scaling application development teams that are self-organizing, loosely coupled, yet highly aligned. ', ' Work directly with our team comprised of the brightest minds in technology, research and mathematics as well as senior interfaces from leading life sciences companies across the globe ', ' Strong verbal and written communication; collaborative focus  Ph.D. or Masters in Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Physics, Bioinformatics, Computational Biology or another quantitative field with strong foundation in healthcare technology and life sciences  4+ years of experience with predictive analytics in a healthcare related field  Proven experience in translating business challenges into data pipelines & model framework, owning and driving successful projects  Excellent presentation and communication skills to diverse audiences  Experience with statistical tools and programming languages that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling large healthcare datasets (R, Python, SQL, Java)  Demonstrated leadership in software engineering and developing data science products into software applications  Experience using Git version control, cloud computing and devops.  Expertise in Natural Language Processing, signal processing and/or image processing a plus ', 'Your Competencies', ' Medidata Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Medidata Solutions provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by the law. Medidata Solutions complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.', ' Design, develop and validate machine learning and AI models for novel medical applications. Areas of team focus include clinical trial analytics, clinical trial operations, central monitoring, and virtual clinical trials ', ' Work directly with our team comprised of the brightest minds in technology, research and life sciences ', ' Proven experience in translating business challenges into data pipelines & model framework, owning and driving successful projects ', ' Solve some of the most complex problems in healthcare, translating complex data into meaningful insights ', ' Productionize data science methods, algorithms and workflows into existing/new products ', ' Demonstrated leadership in software engineering and developing data science products into software applications ', ' Excellent presentation and communication skills to diverse audiences ', ' Build relationships with product management, marketing, sales, and users to enable development teams to more effectively refine system requirements and size delivery efforts. ', ' Solve some of the most complex problems in healthcare, translating complex data into meaningful insights  Provide support functions around model-building, including data cleaning and code review  Proven technical leadership regarding feature design, enhancement and implementation of complex data science software solutions  Provide support functions around model-building, including data cleaning and code review  Ability to understand and peer review complex, multivariable statistical models and data analytics solutions using machine learning algorithms  Ability to work independently on complex and diverse issues and propose solutions  Proven leadership scaling application development teams that are self-organizing, loosely coupled, yet highly aligned.  Ability to translate business challenges into data pipelines & model framework, owning and driving successful projects  Work directly with our team comprised of the brightest minds in technology, research and mathematics as well as senior interfaces from leading life sciences companies across the globe ', ' Experience with statistical tools and programming languages that allow you to be self-sufficient in handling large healthcare datasets (R, Python, SQL, Java) ', ' Provide support functions around model-building, including data cleaning and code review ', ' Expertise in Natural Language Processing, signal processing and/or image processing a plus ', ' Collaborate with Senior Management and major stakeholders to establish and communicate a technical vision for the solution ', ' Be a hands on coach/player type leader  Solve some of the most complex problems in healthcare, translating complex data into meaningful insights  Design, develop and validate machine learning and AI models for novel medical applications. Areas of team focus include clinical trial analytics, clinical trial operations, central monitoring, and virtual clinical trials  Build relationships with product management, marketing, sales, and users to enable development teams to more effectively refine system requirements and size delivery efforts.  Consistently execute against a product roadmap to deliver multiple features  Collaborate with Senior Management and major stakeholders to establish and communicate a technical vision for the solution  Productionize data science methods, algorithms and workflows into existing/new products  Work directly with our team comprised of the brightest minds in technology, research and life sciences ', 'Your Education & Experience', ' Ability to work independently on complex and diverse issues and propose solutions ', ' Ability to translate business challenges into data pipelines & model framework, owning and driving successful projects ', ' Experience using Git version control, cloud computing and devops. ', ' Be a hands on coach/player type leader ', ' 4+ years of experience with predictive analytics in a healthcare related field ', ' Ability to understand and peer review complex, multivariable statistical models and data analytics solutions using machine learning algorithms ', ' Proven technical leadership regarding feature design, enhancement and implementation of complex data science software solutions ']

', 'Atlassian is continuing to hire with all interviewing and on-boarding done virtually due to COVID-19. All new and existing Atlassians will continue to work from home until it’s safe to return to our offices. When our offices re-open, every Atlassian will have the choice to work from an office or from home', 'Extend existing ML libraries and frameworks', 'Experience working in an enterprise or B2B space, as well as the consumer or B2C space', 'Experience developing, building and scaling machine learning models in business applications using large amounts of data', "On the first day, we'll expect you job_title: Lead/ Sr. Data Scientist (Python, Tensorflow, NLP)
job_text: ['', 'Our ideal Data Scientist would have a background in researching Machine Learning algorithms and implementing different deep learning architectures. A passion for writing code would be preferred and the ability to design and apply NLP algorithms to create a better understanding.\xa0', 'Expansive benefits coupled with the promise of exciting technical innovation', 'We can offer our\xa0Senior Compiler Engineer / Software Engineer:', 'A chance to develop the next generation of technology\xa0', 'This MIT spinout is currently seeking a\xa0Lead/Sr. Data Scientist (Python, Tensorflow, NLP) to\xa0join an innovative company bringing automation and optimization services to new heights. This company is\xa0applying cutting edge advances in the fields of operations research and machine learning to solve real-world challenges that will transform navigation for the future.\xa0', '.\xa0', 'Based in the Greater Boston area, Lead/Sr. Data Scientist (Python, Tensorflow, NLP) in this company,\xa0You will have the chance to solve complex problems and see your solutions come to life in different industries through the use of a ML microservice platform that utilizes NLP.', 'A culture rooted in diversity that offers our employees the opportunity to work with some of the best scientists, engineers, and coders from around the globe', 'A chance to develop the next generation of technology\xa0A culture rooted in diversity that offers our employees the opportunity to work with some of the best scientists, engineers, and coders from around the globeExpansive benefits coupled with the promise of exciting technical innovation', 'Key Skills:\xa0Data Scientist, Data Science, Python, Tensorflow, Pytorch, OCR, NLP, Natural Language Processing, Mahine Learning, Machine Learning Algorithms, Deep Learning, Deep Learning Models, C++, Engineer, Design, Computer Vision, Microservices', 'Lead/ Sr. Data Scientist (Python, Tensorflow, NLP)\xa0']

['As part of our Data Engineering team, you will work in cross-functional and Agile project teams consisting of Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, other Data Engineers. In this role, you will work directly with customers and our team to help enable innovation through continuous, hands-on, deployment across technology stacks. You will work to build data pipelines and be involved in the complete end-to-end Data Engineering efforts, including code development, integration, troubleshooting and testing.']

', 'Development experience with Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services.', 'Design and implement data models (MDM hub and staging marts), ETL processes, and integration pipelines.', "Education: Bachelor's degree or 4 years of relevant experience in lieu of degreeExperience: Minimum of 4 years related experience", 'Some experience with REST and .NET preferred', 'Test new software products/updates; working with other members of the Master Data Management team and business partners to improve usability and recommend improvements.', 'Responsibilities:', 'Education: ', 'A strong, talented staff is at the heart of St. Luke’s Health System. We are the state’s largest employer with more than 13,500 employees and a medical staff of more than 1,800 physicians and advanced practice clinicians. Our employees are dedicated to impacting the lives of those in our community while pursuing a life- changing career at St. Luke’s. Our staff is the reason for our outstanding reputation as both a quality employer and superior healthcare organization. We’re proud of our people who deliver skilled, compassionate care every day, and are looking to add dedicated individuals who will continue in the same tradition of excellence.', 'Strong SQL experience, writing queries and stored procedures.Experience with database management systems including performance optimizing and tuning. Development experience with Microsoft SQL Server Integration Services.Exposure to basic data warehousing methodologiesSome experience with REST and .NET preferred', 'Build cross functional relationships with data analytic teams and business leaders to understand information needs, data flows, and data quality considerations to enable solution deployment.', 'Our employees enjoy many benefits, some of the most popular are\xa0tuition reimbursement, hospital retirement contributions, and hospital-supported on-going training and education.', 'Work with architects to implement solutions in alignment with standards.', '\xa0', 'Utilize data quality techniques for data validation, unit testing, and automated integration testing. Implement frameworks for automated and scripted testing.', 'If you’re looking for a place where you can grow in your personal life, in your career, and in your community, St. Luke’s may be just the place for you.', "Education: Bachelor's degree or 4 years of relevant experience in lieu of degree", 'Data Engineer – Intermediate to Advanced', 'As a key member of our Master Data Management team at St Luke’s, you will be integral in developing innovative data solutions for business-critical data that is shared across the enterprise and collectively represents a “single source of truth.” The ideal candidate for this position would have great communication skills, be a curious self-starter, have great analytical and problem-solving skills, and have a passion for delivering technical solutions that enable time-sensitive, critical decisions. In this role some experience with Profisee is preferred, but not required.', "\ufeffAbout St. Luke's:", 'Identify technical solutions that achieve efficiency and effectiveness and enable data usage as a strategic, business asset.', 'Exposure to basic data warehousing methodologies', 'Experience: Minimum of 4 years related experience', 'Required Criteria:', 'Contribute to improving solution stability, reliability, efficiency, and quality.', 'Experience:', 'With multiple locations in the beautiful southern and central Idaho, our mild, four season climate means you can play outdoors year-round. Whether you prefer leisurely walks along the river or heart-pounding climbs up a sheer cliff- there is always something to do after work. An exciting mix of urban and outdoor life defines Idaho’s culture, you can ski in the morning and watch a college sporting event at night. It is a great state to raise a family and forge lasting relationships. The cost of living is low, and quality of life is high.', "Do you like working on things that positively impact the health of your friends, family, neighbors, and community?\xa0St. Luke's is the region’s leading health system, locally owned and not-for-profit. One of just four U.S. health systems to achieve Magnet accreditation four times, we’re an attractive place to grow your career. Being ranked at the top is great validation for the work we do, but our friends and neighbors are the real winners."]

job_title: AI Research scientist: up to $350,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities:', 'We are looking for talented research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Job Description:', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting-edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. We have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We are backed by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $18 million.\xa0', 'General Requirements:', 'Coming up with new techniques in unsupervised learning, dataset augmentation, and deep reinforcement learning that can be applied to automating various parts of the AI development workflow.', 'Candidates will need to have a PhD preferably in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning. We are looking for people who have done research and/or published papers in one of the following areas: Unsupervised Learning; Generative Modeling; Deep Neural Networks; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Generative Adversarial Networks; Causal Reasoning. Ideal candidates would be able to rapidly build on new ideas with engineers, potentially publish at top conferences, and be able to write code.']

We are creative, take thoughtful risks, and ultimately learn and recover from failures.', 'Communicating results and recommendations to senior management ', 'Demonstrated experience in statistical modeling and analysis.\xa0 Expert level skills in Python or R.', 'Very strong analytical skills, combined with an ability to tie analytic results to business implications.', 'THE OPPORTUNITY:', 'COLLABORATE (with everybody): ', 'WHO WE ARE:', 'Design experiments and evaluate the results ', 'Proficiency in qualitative and quantitative data analysis and reporting.', '0 - 7+ years of total experience. Financial services or mortgage experience, is not required, but is preferred.\xa0', 'High level of comfort working within the financial services industry, as well as working within a rapidly growing environment in which change is a constant.\xa0', 'Care (for everyone): ', 'Responsibility: ', 'Identify and apply best practices and innovative solutions for optimization of customer life cycle.', 'Drive better understanding of FFN customers and prospects. Optimize customer experience and FFN value proposition by leveraging of GLM, supervised and unsupervised ML modeling solutions.Utilize your technical and analytical skills, while also gaining in-depth exposure to business strategy.Act as consultant to cross functional teams, advise how to best leverage predictive modeling and data in general.\xa0', 'Drive better understanding of FFN customers and prospects. Optimize customer experience and FFN value proposition by leveraging of GLM, supervised and unsupervised ML modeling solutions.', 'Act as consultant to cross functional teams, advise how to best leverage predictive modeling and data in general.\xa0', 'Design, build, optimize and maintain customer LTV / lifecycle modeling platforms. ', 'Experience with use of credit bureau data for statistical modeling', 'A can do attitude for problem solving.', 'Aptitude working with relational databases and manipulating data from databases for statistical modeling.', 'A keen eye to spot opportunities to automate and streamline analytic processes.', 'Ad-hoc Statistical requests ', 'What began with 2 people in a spare bedroom has now rapidly expanded to a vibrant business that employs over 2000 employees (known internally as The Freedom Family) in two locations: San Mateo, CA and Tempe, AZ. When you visit either of our offices, you’ll understand why our employees have voted us the Best Place to Work for the last several years. It’s a place where the Heart/$ philosophy continues to thrive, where we believe that success is only achieved by doing what’s right for our customers, our employees, and our communities.', 'CULTURAL FIT (Our Core Values):\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0', 'Expert SAS/R/Python knowledge ', 'Utilize your technical and analytical skills, while also gaining in-depth exposure to business strategy.', 'An ability to work independently with limited direction but with the judgment to do so within appropriate limits of authority.\xa0', '3 weeks’ paid vacation (increased with tenure)', 'act with integrity', 'Analyze data, build models and assess their quality ', 'Experience working with relational databases ', 'Attention Agencies & Search Firms: We do not accept unsolicited candidate resumes or profiles. Please do not reach out to anyone within Freedom Financial Network (FFN) to market your services or candidates. All inquiries should be directed to Talent Acquisition only. We reserve the right to hire any candidates sent unsolicited and will not pay any fees without a contract signed by FFN’s Talent Acquisition leader. Thank you for your consideration.', 'Care (for everyone): We show compassion and contribute to the well-being and growth of those around us. ['', 'Overview:', 'Benefits:', 'Join a fast-growing company early, make a difference, and enjoy the journey!', 'Data Engineer', 'Lead our data operations with a thorough knowledge and understanding of relational databases, data structures, and the ability to cleanse, analyze, and connect data from multiple sources.Catalog Management: Develop and monitor utilities to ensure all supplier catalogs and items are accurate, up to date, and exposed to the correct customers; manage all functions of the product catalog, including initial upload, periodic updates, and troubleshooting any data quality issues.Design standardized and scalable processes to integrate text files in a variety of formats (CSV, pipe-delimited, fixed-width, etc.) into Salesforce.Execute daily operational activities related to EDI and other interface platforms including, mapping, operational monitoring, and error handling.Be the hands-on subject matter expert on data operations and data engineering within GraphiteRx.Evaluate existing and emerging technologies; select and implement the necessary data tools to do your job effectively and efficiently.', 'Design standardized and scalable processes to integrate text files in a variety of formats (CSV, pipe-delimited, fixed-width, etc.) into Salesforce.', 'Primary Responsibilities:', 'We are seeking a\xa0Data Engineer. In this role, you will demonstrate experience and technical aptitude at collecting, cleansing, enriching, aggregating, and loading data from different sources into our data management platform. You will also play an integral part on our long-term data strategy, including the design and implementation of a data warehouse for reporting and analytics. The ideal candidate is thoughtful, organized, efficient, and a flexible team player with excellent analytical, written, and verbal communication skills. Keen attention to detail, a deep intuition for designing efficient data pipelines, and anticipating key data issues are essential.', 'Competitive compensation, startup options, and a rich benefits package, which includes health, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, a generous leave policy, and more.', 'Evaluate existing and emerging technologies; select and implement the necessary data tools to do your job effectively and efficiently.', 'GraphiteRx is a modern pharmacy marketplace platform that is transforming healthcare by reimagining how pharmacies and suppliers do business, together. We empower pharmaceutical suppliers to better serve customers by making it easier for pharmacies and clinics to procure medications in a more cost-effective manner. Our belief is simple. When we help pharmacies and suppliers win, patients and healthcare win too! GraphiteRx is located in Nashville, TN and is backed by Bowery Capital and lool Ventures.', 'Catalog Management: Develop and monitor utilities to ensure all supplier catalogs and items are accurate, up to date, and exposed to the correct customers; manage all functions of the product catalog, including initial upload, periodic updates, and troubleshooting any data quality issues.', 'GraphiteRx is committed to building a diverse and inclusive company that celebrates and develops individuals of all backgrounds. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage all applicants.', '2+ years of experience in a data engineering, data management, analytics, or data-centric customer facing role, preferably in a fast-paced startup environment in a health tech, pharma tech, e-commerce, or marketplace business.', 'General understand of how data engineering workflows feed into data visualization software such as Tableau, Qlik, and PowerBI.', 'Master Data Management (MDM) experience with large ERP or supply chain platforms is preferred; experience extracting, transforming, and loading pharmacy data is a plus.', 'Technical skills including advanced knowledge of spreadsheet tools (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets),\xa0command-line scripting (Bash, ZSH),\xa0database languages (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server), data engineering with open-source languages such as Python (Luigi, Airflow, Pandas, Spark), and general familiarity with cloud-based data integration tools such as AWS Glue and Azure Data Factory.', 'Centrally located office in Nashville within walking distance from great restaurants and coffee shops.', 'Lead our data operations with a thorough knowledge and understanding of relational databases, data structures, and the ability to cleanse, analyze, and connect data from multiple sources.', '2+ years of experience in a data engineering, data management, analytics, or data-centric customer facing role, preferably in a fast-paced startup environment in a health tech, pharma tech, e-commerce, or marketplace business.Technical skills including advanced knowledge of spreadsheet tools (Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets),\xa0command-line scripting (Bash, ZSH),\xa0database languages (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server), data engineering with open-source languages such as Python (Luigi, Airflow, Pandas, Spark), and general familiarity with cloud-based data integration tools such as AWS Glue and Azure Data Factory.General understand of how data engineering workflows feed into data visualization software such as Tableau, Qlik, and PowerBI.Master Data Management (MDM) experience with large ERP or supply chain platforms is preferred; experience extracting, transforming, and loading pharmacy data is a plus.Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or Data Analytics or related experience; Master’s or PharmD degree is a plus.Experience handling multiple projects while successfully meeting project deadlines and a desire to take on increased responsibilities quickly; project manage experience is a plus.', 'please include a brief cover letter/email explaining why you are the right person for our team!', 'Fun startup work environment with catered team lunches, happy hours, and team events.', 'Qualifications:', 'Execute daily operational activities related to EDI and other interface platforms including, mapping, operational monitoring, and error handling.', 'Be the hands-on subject matter expert on data operations and data engineering within GraphiteRx.', 'When you apply for this role online,\xa0please include a brief cover letter/email explaining why you are the right person for our team!', 'Join a fast-growing company early, make a difference, and enjoy the journey!Competitive compensation, startup options, and a rich benefits package, which includes health, dental, vision, life insurance, 401k, a generous leave policy, and more.Fun startup work environment with catered team lunches, happy hours, and team events.Centrally located office in Nashville within walking distance from great restaurants and coffee shops.', 'Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, or Data Analytics or related experience; Master’s or PharmD degree is a plus.', 'Experience handling multiple projects while successfully meeting project deadlines and a desire to take on increased responsibilities quickly; project manage experience is a plus.']

job_title: Lead Data Scientist & Analytics Engineer Job
job_text: ['', ' Create tools for automated domain-specific template driven configuration and deployment of analytics pipelines at scale ', ' 8+ years of experience in building Analytics solutions ', ' 5+ years of experience in building and operationalizing analytics pipelines and services adopting container ecosystem of Docker, Kubernetes. ', 'Responsibilities', ' Accommodation for Applicants with Disabilities: ', ' Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high quality services ', ' Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills ', ' 3+ years’ experience using one or more of the following: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, SparkML, etc. ', 'Qualifications', '  Leverage multiple real-time telemetry, batch and master data sources to design, test, optimize and deploy end-to-end pipelines for large-scale continuous ML workloads and the exploitation of the ML and data science models in analytics and prediction workloads and microservices   Write scalable, distributed and highly efficient code with demonstrated proficiency in programming in one or more languages such as Scala, Python, Java and other coding languages; proficiency in exploiting distributed and concurrent computing frameworks such as Akka, Spark and Kafka   Create tools for automated domain-specific template driven configuration and deployment of analytics pipelines at scale   Create templates for containerization and cloud deployment using Azure, Docker, Kubernetes containerization or similar   Mentor junior analytics engineers and collaborate with peer teams across the organization.  ', ' MS or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field, or equivalent professional experience ', ' Initiative and passion for finding solutions to hard problems at scale and operationalizing them ', ' Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries. ', ' Create templates for containerization and cloud deployment using Azure, Docker, Kubernetes containerization or similar ', ' 5+ years of demonstrated AI/ML and Deep Learning development in production pipelines with relevant code experience ', ' Mentor junior analytics engineers and collaborate with peer teams across the organization. ', ' Write scalable, distributed and highly efficient code with demonstrated proficiency in programming in one or more languages such as Scala, Python, Java and other coding languages; proficiency in exploiting distributed and concurrent computing frameworks such as Akka, Spark and Kafka ', 'We invite you to apply today to join us as We Light the Way to a Brilliant, Productive, and Connected World!', '  MS or PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field, or equivalent professional experience   8+ years of experience in building Analytics solutions   5+ years of experience in building and operationalizing analytics pipelines and services adopting container ecosystem of Docker, Kubernetes.   5+ years of demonstrated AI/ML and Deep Learning development in production pipelines with relevant code experience   3+ years’ experience using one or more of the following: TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, SparkML, etc.   5+ years’ experience using one or more of the following: Spark, Spark (structured) Streaming, Akka, Kafka, etc.   Experience working in a data intensive environment and translating business needs into data requirements   Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills   Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high quality services   Initiative and passion for finding solutions to hard problems at scale and operationalizing them   Demonstrated ability to work in ambiguous situations and across organizational boundaries.   Respect, Accountability, Integrity and a Positive Can-Do attitude  ', ' 5+ years’ experience using one or more of the following: Spark, Spark (structured) Streaming, Akka, Kafka, etc. ', 'We Light the Way!', ' Leverage multiple real-time telemetry, batch and master data sources to design, test, optimize and deploy end-to-end pipelines for large-scale continuous ML workloads and the exploitation of the ML and data science models in analytics and prediction workloads and microservices ', ' Experience working in a data intensive environment and translating business needs into data requirements ', ' Respect, Accountability, Integrity and a Positive Can-Do attitude ']

You must keep the JobID: linkedin : SW3-1604013 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***', 'Great medical, dental & vision Insurance packages', 'Contribute to the development of data pipelines', 'Competitive salary with high bonus potentialCollaborative and creative atmosphere, with inspired leadershipCareer advancement opportunitiesRecognition and reward for outstanding performanceGreat medical, dental & vision Insurance packagesCompetitive 401K with company match to plan for the long termUnlimited paid-time-offTransportation benefits & cell phone reimbursementCasual dress all day, every day', 'Deliver output of the highest quality, including code, models, & documentation', 'Nice to have: Exposure to ad tech concepts & terminology']

['', 'Our biggest assets are the 20+ employees whose resilience has helped us achieve tremendous growth in revenue and customers and build top-notch customer confidence.\xa0Arima Genomics is growing rapidly and offers excellent opportunities for career development.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Ph.D. in Molecular Biology, Genomics or other related scientific field', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Create and implement QC metrics with appropriate thresholds to aid in quality management.', 'Role: ', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Execute experiments at the bench according to research project plan.', 'What you will do:', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Contribute to the design and planning of product development experiments and timelines', 'Role: Scientist I – Product Development', '• Design and implement bioinformatics tools for data QC and drive data interpretation and future direction proposals.', 'What we are looking for:', '• Assay Development - design and execution of early stage proof of concept experiments, optimization of genomics assays and workflows for target specifications and robustness, edge testing, perform basic statistical analysis of results to aid in interpretation, and perform troubleshooting / root cause analyses.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0A strong interest and belief in the power of genomic structure to revolutionize human disease research.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Participate in additional special team or individual projects.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Anticipate project challenges early, work to resolve them, and utilize good judgement when raising challenges to management.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Present at scientific meetings and travel to customer sites as needed.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Mentor more junior employees and collaborate effectively with peers, cross-functional teams and mangers across the organization.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Strong working knowledge of a variety of genomics assays such as HiC, ChIP, RNA-seq or others as well as next-generation sequencing (NGS) sample prep methods for low input or FFPE samples.', 'Arima Genomics believes that everyone has the ability to contribute to company success, and we are committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.', 'Company Description:', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Hands-on experience and proven proficiencies working with bioinformatics analysis of NGS data - the ability to both understand and use existing bioinformatics tools, as well as write custom data analysis and data visualization programs. Proficiency in at least one programming language.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Excellent written and verbal technical communication skills.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Contribute experiments, analysis, and writing for research proposals, patent applications, SOPs, user guides, and technical notes as necessary.', 'How will you make an impact?', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Assist in technology transfer between Product Development and Manufacturing.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Demonstrated leadership, initiative, organizational skills, and inter-personal communication abilities.', 'Arima Genomics’ mission is to develop technologies that enable concurrent sequencing of genome sequence and structure, to accelerate understanding of the genetics of human health and disease.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Stay well-informed on current technology trends and scientific literature related to your specific project, as well as the broad application areas of Arima’s products and services.', 'Arima Genomics is a San Diego-based startup which is revolutionizing the way Genomic Data is used in basic and Disease research. The Scientist I position will play an integral role in the development of genomic products for basic and disease research. This position requires a leader who thrives in a fast-paced working environment, and possesses a well-rounded genomics skill set to design and execute thoughtful experiments, conduct bioinformatics analysis and interpretations, and communicate results and propose future directions to peers and management. This work will be in the context of creating the highest quality and highest performing assay’s to meet our customer’s needs and will interface with Customer Support, Marketing, QC, Bioinformatics, and Manufacturing.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Demonstrated ability to drive research projects in a team environment.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Participate in R&D lab meetings, fostering an environment of intellectual curiosity and critical thinking, while maintaining an awareness for technology commercialization and product development', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Passion for developing high quality genomics products.', '•\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Present interpreted results and proposals of next steps to management.']

['', 'Have experience building software solutions for customer needs', 'Our data science team takes ideas from inception to new machine learning-powered features that ship to our hundreds of thousands of users. You’ll be central to creating features that help our customers learn and grow from their data. For this role, we’re looking for people who are first and foremost software engineers with an interest in data science.', 'Design and implement systems that run correctly, securely and reliably at scale.', 'Be full stack, owning front-end and back-end projects.', 'Technologies we use (not comprehensive!):', 'HTML, JavaScript, React', 'Numpy, Scipy, Pandas', 'Have experience implementing machine learning models, data pipelines and testing frameworks for research and production use.', 'Python', 'Understand how to profile code and optimize performance.', 'Who You Are:', 'Klaviyo is the world’s leading owned marketing platform known for accelerating revenue for online businesses using the channels they own like email, web, and mobile. Enabling companies to leverage these owned marketing channels, Klaviyo makes it easy to store, access, analyze and use transactional and behavioral data to power highly-targeted customer and prospect communications. And unlike other marketing platforms, Klaviyo doesn’t force companies to compromise between advanced functionality or ease of use - so companies of all sizes are able to maximize their sales quickly. That’s why over 50,000 innovative companies like Unilever, Custom Ink and Eventbrite sell more with Klaviyo.', 'Have a bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, applied math, statistics or other relevant quantitative discipline, or equivalent industry experience.', 'Klaviyo is growing fast and we have openings for all skill levels across all of our teams. Learn more about our engineering culture at\xa0https://klaviyo.tech\xa0and listen to our data science team podcast at\xa0https://medium.com/klaviyo-data-science', 'Have experience building software solutions for customer needsHave experience implementing machine learning models, data pipelines and testing frameworks for research and production use.Have experience processing cloud-scale data using parallel, elastic, streaming and similar techniques.Understand how to profile code and optimize performance.Aspire to correctness (e.g. in your code, in drawing conclusions from data)Have a bachelor’s or advanced degree in computer science, applied math, statistics or other relevant quantitative discipline, or equivalent industry experience.', 'Get to know Klaviyo', 'Aurora, Cassandra, Kafka', 'Have experience processing cloud-scale data using parallel, elastic, streaming and similar techniques.', 'Aspire to correctness (e.g. in your code, in drawing conclusions from data)', 'How you will make a difference:', 'Build products that enable our customers to grow faster using data science.', 'SageMaker', 'Design and implement systems that run correctly, securely and reliably at scale.Build products that enable our customers to grow faster using data science.Be full stack, owning front-end and back-end projects.', 'Get to know Klaviyo\xa0', 'We love programming and the excitement that comes with building something people use. We are the kind of people that love talking to users and can find the balance between solving a\xa0problem quickly and thinking about how your code will work in the future. We love to move fast, keep learning and get stuff done.']
