', 'Our client a stable and growing late-stage start-up is hiring a 100% Remote Pipeline Data Engineer. The Pipeline Data Engineer will help architect and develop our evolving data platform. The Pipeline Data Engineer role will be part of our growing data team, interfacing closely with software engineering. If you are a highly independent worker and have excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, this is the job for you.', '\xa0', 'As a member of a small but growing data team, you will be working closely with business partners, and software engineering teams playing a vital role in the design, build, and maintenance of data pipelines; providing timely, accurate, and reliable information to all aspects of the business. As we incrementally improve and expand our company, you will be building new systems from the ground up or replacing legacy systems outright, free from supporting legacy code bases.', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa03+ years of data and/or software engineering experience', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Developing streaming data flows (i.e., w/ Kafka, AWS Kinesis, AWS SQS, Spark Streaming)', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experience architecting cloud data solutions', '·\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0\xa0Experienced developing testable ETL solutions in python']

job_title: Sr. Data Scientist, Global Supply Chain
job_text: ['', 'Develop statistical/machine learning models to elevate business process performance and decision-making.', 'RESPONSIBILITIES:', 'Experience working with IT and / or DBAs in respect to projects involving large databases.', 'Experience communicating the results of analysis with product and leadership teams to influence the strategy of the product.', 'The team is ready to act immediately on those candidates who are the best fit for the role. You’ll first hear from someone in Talent Acquisition to schedule a phone screen, and then the next step will be a personal interview with our Hiring Manager. We pride ourselves on moving through processes quickly, and you can be sure of transparency and prompt communication throughout.', 'Skills & Experience:', 'Lead production development of Global Supply Chain visualizations and reporting to track, measure, flag key indicators for the purpose of assessing global business process health.', 'Proficient writing complex SQL queries.', 'Lead production development of Global Supply Chain visualizations and reporting to track, measure, flag key indicators for the purpose of assessing global business process health.Lead engagements for collaborative analytics programs with universities; delivering meaningful outcomes and building relationships with students and faculty.Mentor other members of the global team on statistical methods, analysis and data quality.Perform and communicate comprehensive exploratory analysis to understanding drivers, impacts, and key influences on decision-making within different each sub-process.Develop statistical/machine learning models to elevate business process performance and decision-making.Collaborate with business partners to develop new approaches to meet business goals using analytics and effectively communicating your analytics approach.', 'Ability to resolve complex problems and break them down to analyze possible solutions.', '5+ years of experience as a data scientist.', 'Tenneco’s Motorparts (DRiV) is a world leader in the international automotive aftermarket built from the combined strengths of Tenneco, Federal-Mogul and Öhlins with 31 of the best known and respected aftermarket brands, including 14 brands 100 years or older. Our colleagues throughout 25 countries around the world work as one team, driving advancements that help our customers get the most from every vehicle, every ride, every race and every journey.', 'Perform and communicate comprehensive exploratory analysis to understanding drivers, impacts, and key influences on decision-making within different each sub-process.', 'Collaborate with business partners to develop new approaches to meet business goals using analytics and effectively communicating your analytics approach.', '\xa0', 'Advocate for analytics approach to business problems where use of data may be scarce.', 'Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work across multiple groups within the organization.', 'Mentor other members of the global team on statistical methods, analysis and data quality.', 'We are looking for a Sr. Data Scientist, Global Supply Chain. Reporting to the Executive Director, Global Supply Chain Business Intelligence & Analytics, the Senior Data Scientist is responsible for the transformative analytics programs within Supply Chain.\xa0These may include, but are not limited to, customer fulfillment, inventory management and global spend.\xa0An important component is data accuracy and standardization, and this role will be responsible for data analysis to implement global data standards across multiple data sources. The Senior Data Scientist will work with our business partners in Supply Chain to identify/analyze data quality issues, design the solution and coordinate the changes. The Sr. Data Scientist will be responsible for successful deployment of reporting and analytics projects.', '5+ years of experience as a data scientist.Experience communicating the results of analysis with product and leadership teams to influence the strategy of the product.Proficient writing complex SQL queries.Experience working with IT and / or DBAs in respect to projects involving large databases.Experience in a scripting language (Python preferred).Strong understanding of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions, ML systems).Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work across multiple groups within the organization.Ability to resolve complex problems and break them down to analyze possible solutions.Advocate for analytics approach to business problems where use of data may be scarce.', 'Lead engagements for collaborative analytics programs with universities; delivering meaningful outcomes and building relationships with students and faculty.', 'Experience in a scripting language (Python preferred).', 'Strong understanding of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions, ML systems).', 'Education:\xa0Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Analytics or related field required. Master’s degree in quantitative field (computer science, data science, data analytics, business analytics preferred).']

Each day, we work with institutions and organizations that seek to disrupt markets, understand and influence behavior, drive action on a national scale, and create positive impact. Our approach extends far beyond our client portfolio—as a certified B Corporation and a 2020 Greenbook Top 50 Market Research Company, we make a difference in our community through corporate-sponsored employee volunteer programs and pro bono partnerships with values-aligned nonprofits. Most importantly, as a 2019 Washington Post Top Workplace, we are committed to putting people first and foster a culture that reflects that commitment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we celebrate diversity and inclusivity as the foundation of a healthy, successful, and innovative work environment. Join us, and together we can work to ensure a better tomorrow.']

', 'Demonstrates up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationales.', 'Data Strategy: Understands, articulates, and applies principles of the defined strategy to routine business problems that involve a single function.', 'Data Source Identification: Supports the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Develops knowledge of current data science and analytics trends.', 'Creates training documentation and trains end-users on data modeling. job_title: AI Research scientist: up to $350,000 base+equity
job_text: ['', 'Responsibilities:', 'We are looking for talented research scientists to be part of the founding team. You will help build the product that applies unsupervised learning to model the world and automatically creates and manages production grade AI systems. As an initial member of the founding team, you get to own a significant chunk of the company, shape its culture and work on state-of-the-art science and technology.', 'Job Description:', 'We are a stealth startup building a cutting-edge cloud AI service. Our founders have a wealth of experience working on various ground-breaking products including self driving cars, AWS AI services, GMail, Google Docs and flash storage systems. We have also previously been founders and early employees at startups. We are backed by Eric Schmidt and Decibel Ventures with Series A funding of $18 million.\xa0', 'General Requirements:', 'Coming up with new techniques in unsupervised learning, dataset augmentation, and deep reinforcement learning that can be applied to automating various parts of the AI development workflow.', 'Candidates will need to have a PhD preferably in Artificial Intelligence or Machine Learning. We are looking for people who have done research and/or published papers in one of the following areas: Unsupervised Learning; Generative Modeling; Deep Neural Networks; Deep Reinforcement Learning; Generative Adversarial Networks; Causal Reasoning. Ideal candidates would be able to rapidly build on new ideas with engineers, potentially publish at top conferences, and be able to write code.']

company: St. Jude Children's Research Hospital - ALSAC
job_text: ['', 'St. Jude is an Equal Opportunity Employer', 'Minimum Education', 'Minimum Experience', 'Ideal candidates will have experience building, tailoring, and deploying analysis pipelines using widely available genomic analysis toolkits (e.g. bedtools, samtools), as well as experience managing large numbers of datasets.\xa0The successful candidate will be tasked with collaborative research within and beyond the lab, so strong communication and interpersonal skills are essential.\xa0Additional experience in a fundamental understanding of gene expression mechanisms (e.g. transcription factors, enhancers, genome structure, and transcriptional condensates), and experience building succinct, clear figures using R are preferred.', 'No Search Firms:', 'Dowen JM, Fan ZP, Hnisz D, Ren G, Abraham BJ, Zhang LN, Weintraub AS, Schujiers J, Lee TI, Zhao K, Young RA.\xa0Control of cell identity genes occurs in insulated neighborhoods in mammalian chromosomes.\xa0Cell.\xa02014 Oct 9;159(2):374-387.\xa0doi: 10.1016/j.cell.2014.09.030.\xa0PubMed PMID: 25303531; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC4197132.', 'St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital is seeking multiple Bioinformatics Research Scientists to study the role of the genome and other nuclear organization in pediatric cancers.\xa0Recognized for state-of-the-art computational infrastructure, well-established analytical pipelines, and deep genomic analysis expertise, St. Jude offers a work environment where you will directly impact the care of pediatric cancer patients. As a Bioinformatics Research Scientist, your responsibilities include analyzing data generated from a variety of second-and third-generation sequencing applications that interrogate a broad range of human gene regulatory biology.', 'PhD in Molecular Biology, Biochemistry, Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics or related field required.', 'Salary is highly competitive (comparable to industry) and\xa0employee benefits are outstanding. Relocation assistance is available. Working at St. Jude provides the opportunity to make a tangible difference to pediatric cancer patient care and survival and St. Jude has been consistently ranked in Fortune magazine’s “100 Best Places to Work” list and is exceptionally positively reviewed on GlassDoor.', 'Ph.D which must include research related to bioinformatics (such as analysis of sequence data, microarrays, SNPs, image data, proteomics data, or biological pathways; development of algorithms, statistical methods, or scientific software); OR If Ph.D with no bioinformatics research, then two (2) years of pre-or postdoctoral experience in Computational Biology or Bioinformatics research is required.', 'Experience with programming languages such as Perl, C, or Java required.', "St. Jude Children's Research Hospital does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. Please do not call or email. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee or other representative at St. Jude via email, the internet, or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place and approved by HR will result in no fee being paid in the event the candidate is hired by St. Jude.", '\xa0', 'Hnisz D, Abraham BJ, Lee TI, Lau A, Saint-André V, Sigova AA, Hoke HA, Young RA. Super-enhancers in the control of cell identity and disease. Cell. 2013 Nov 7;155(4):934-47. doi: 10.1016/j.cell.2013.09.053. Epub 2013 Oct 10. PubMed PMID: 24119843; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC3841062.', 'Relevant Papers:', 'The successful candidate will become a fundamental component of a multidisciplinary, inter-institutional team assembled to study how genome structures meaningfully differ between normal and pediatric cancer cells.\xa0', 'Benefits', 'Ph.D which must include research related to bioinformatics (such as analysis of sequence data, microarrays, SNPs, image data, proteomics data, or biological pathways; development of algorithms, statistical methods, or scientific software); OR If Ph.D with no bioinformatics research, then two (2) years of pre-or postdoctoral experience in Computational Biology or Bioinformatics research is required.Experience with programming languages such as Perl, C, or Java required.', 'The department of Computational Biology provides access to high-performance computing clusters, cloud computing environment, innovative visualization tools, highly automated analytical pipelines, and mentorship from faculty scientists with experience in data analysis, data management, and delivery of high-quality results for competitive projects. We encourage first author, high profile publications to share this element of discovery.\xa0Take the first step to join our team by applying now!', 'Abraham BJ, Hnisz D, Weintraub AS, Kwiatkowski N, Li CH, Li Z, Weichert-Leahey N, Rahman S, Liu Y, Etchin J, Li B, Shen S, Lee TI, Zhang J, Look AT, Mansour MR, Young RA. Small genomic insertions form enhancers that misregulate oncogenes. Nat Commun. 2017 Feb 9;8:14385. doi: 10.1038/ncomms14385. PubMed PMID: 28181482; PubMed Central PMCID: PMC5309821.', 'The Abraham lab studies gene expression-regulation mechanisms in healthy and diseased mammalian cells. We are recruiting computational biologists to collaboratively develop computational tools and frameworks to analyze high-throughput sequencing (-omics) data.\xa0We build analytical software pipelines to find answers to biological questions about gene regulation in big datasets, usually from applied sequencing experiments like ChIP-Seq, RNA-Seq, and Hi-ChIP. Our interests center on enhancers and super-enhancers. Specifically, we seek to understand how these regulatory elements establish gene expression programs in healthy cells, and how enhancers are altered by mutation, abused by mistargeting, and targetable with drugs in diseased cells.\xa0We focus on characterizing the core regulatory circuitries driving disease-relevant cells, and on understanding how mutations in the non-coding DNA of such cells can drive disease, including cancers, through gene misregulation.\xa0']

job_title: Research Scientist: Hemodynamics and Cardiopulmonary System
job_text: ['', 'Must Haves', "Autonomous Healthcare is a medical technology company developing the next generation of devices for healthcare. The company has received numerous Government grants (NASA, NIH, NSF, DoD) to commercialize new technologies. Our company's mission is to commercialize breakthrough medical technologies predicated on state-of-the-art frameworks in machine learning, computer vision, and autonomous systems.", 'M.S. degree in electrical engineering or biomedical engineering.', 'Strong interest in research and learning new technologies.', 'Understanding of numerical solutions to ordinary differential equations', 'Prior expertise in in silico simulation of physiological systems and data analysis acquired from physiological systems.', 'Understanding of signal processing techniques.', 'About Us', 'We have an opening for a Research Scientist/Engineer with a focus on analysis of physiological data such as data from the respiratory system, cardiovascular system, etc. The ideal candidate has a background in machine learning and numerical simulation of phsyiological systems and is excited by the idea of contributing to a problem of high impact to intensive care units.', 'Expertise and innovation in methods, theory, and application of machine learning with a broad understanding of methodological approaches and proficiency in practice.', 'Description', 'M.S. degree in electrical engineering or biomedical engineering.Prior expertise in in silico simulation of physiological systems and data analysis acquired from physiological systems.Expertise and innovation in methods, theory, and application of machine learning with a broad understanding of methodological approaches and proficiency in practice.Understanding of signal processing techniques.Strong interest in research and learning new technologies.Experience with Python.Understanding of numerical solutions to ordinary differential equations', 'Experience with Python.']

['', "M.S. with more than 3 years experience or B.S. with more than 6 years of experience or Pharmaceutics, Chemistry, Chemical/Biochemical Engineering, Pharmacy, Biochemistry, Bioengineering, Biotechnology, Biology or equivalent with 0-3 years' experience ", 'Eligible for Employee Referral Bonus: Yes', 'with a multi-disciplinary team of scientists for formulation optimization and overall candidate progression. ', 'Participate in developing parenteral formulations for biotherapeutic modalities such as monoclonal antibodies, antibody drug conjugates, proteins and vaccines. Participate in developing and defining novel formulations for protein therapeutics products. This position will be responsible to assist in developing manufacturing processes (under general supervision). ', 'This position will be responsible for preparing data summary presentation, compiling data and authoring technical reports. ', 'Participate in developing parenteral formulations for biotherapeutic modalities such as monoclonal antibodies, antibody drug conjugates, proteins and vaccines. Participate in developing and defining novel formulations for protein therapeutics products. This position will be responsible to assist in developing manufacturing processes (under general supervision). Perform rapid, comprehensive characterization of candidate molecules to determine the stability profile and applying this information to develop an appropriate dosage form to meet clinical needs. This will be achieved by applying various biophysical and biochemical techniques such as HPLC (SE-HPLC, IEX, RP-HPLC), SDS-PAGE, Capillary Gel electrophoresis (CGE), imaged Capillary Electrophoresis (iCE), Spectroscopy techniques such as UV and Fluorescence spectroscopy, Circular Dichroism and FTIR. The incumbent will assist in the development and scale-up of processes from bench top to pilot scale and, as required, technology transfer to commercial plants. The Scientist must be able to interact effectivelywith a multi-disciplinary team of scientists for formulation optimization and overall candidate progression. This position will be responsible for preparing data summary presentation, compiling data and authoring technical reports. Effective communication skills are desirable for interactions with laboratory scientists, project managers and colleagues from numerous functions, serving on multi-disciplinary project teams. ', 'Effective communication skills are desirable for interactions with laboratory scientists, project managers and colleagues from numerous functions, serving on multi-disciplinary project teams. This role compiles and reviews data, often disparate and inconsistent, to address complex intelligence issues or problems for customers. This role requires constructing and performing complex statistical, mathematical, and data analysis independently, or in partnership with other data scientists or analysts. job_title: Senior Data Scientist, Computational Biology and/or Computational Chemistry
job_text: ['', 'Experience with modern statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, particularly in the context of large-scale, highthroughput dataset analysis (‘omics or otherwise), including linear/logistic regression, mixed effect modeling, hierarchical models, Bayesian networks, non-negative matrix factorization, CCA/PLS/LDA, etc.; familiarity with fully-Bayesian inference using tools such as Stan or JAGS/BUGS is a plus.', '30+ leading companies ', 'Direct experience or exposure to the drug discovery process, with an understanding of how computational methods deliver impact on preclinical (target identification & validation; small molecule development; elucidating molecular mechanisms of action and modifiers of effects; biomarker discovery & validation) and clinical (patient selection, responder enrichment) phases of development.', 'Strong familiarity with the various tools and environments for successful, modern data science: beyond a fundamental comfort zone with the shell, Python/R, and other scripting languages, you have experience using HPC/grid/cloud computing environments, programming against API services, accessing data from a heterogeneous mixture of flatfiles, SQL relational databases, noSQL/JSON object storage, and/or RDF/OWL triple-stores.', 'Organize, mine, explore, and interpret laboratory assay and ‘omics datasets from multiple sources under multiple conditions (e.g. internal, CRO, publication, consortium, and patent data)', 'A PhD (or Masters with experience) in Computational Chemistry, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or related quantitative fields, with domain expertise demonstrated through your publications, presentations, and history of achievements.', 'About The Role', 'Strong personal project management skills with significant practical experience managing your time split between multiple, parallel projects; experience with Agile processes and frameworks for team collaboration (e.g. Kanban, Trello, Atlassian tools)', 'Train, assess, deploy, and interpret statistical machine learning models that inform, derisk, and advance our programs.', 'About Us', 'Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, including facility with Rmarkdown and/or Jupyter Notebooks for communicating reproducible results; and the ability to also condense, summarize, and synthesize those results into informative and actionable presentations to less technical audiences.', ' A PhD (or Masters with experience) in Computational Chemistry, Computational Biology, Bioinformatics, or related quantitative fields, with domain expertise demonstrated through your publications, presentations, and history of achievements. Direct experience or exposure to the drug discovery process, with an understanding of how computational methods deliver impact on preclinical (target identification & validation; small molecule development; elucidating molecular mechanisms of action and modifiers of effects; biomarker discovery & validation) and clinical (patient selection, responder enrichment) phases of development. Experience with modern statistical analysis and machine learning techniques, particularly in the context of large-scale, highthroughput dataset analysis (‘omics or otherwise), including linear/logistic regression, mixed effect modeling, hierarchical models, Bayesian networks, non-negative matrix factorization, CCA/PLS/LDA, etc.; familiarity with fully-Bayesian inference using tools such as Stan or JAGS/BUGS is a plus. Strong familiarity with the various tools and environments for successful, modern data science: beyond a fundamental comfort zone with the shell, Python/R, and other scripting languages, you have experience using HPC/grid/cloud computing environments, programming against API services, accessing data from a heterogeneous mixture of flatfiles, SQL relational databases, noSQL/JSON object storage, and/or RDF/OWL triple-stores. Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills, including facility with Rmarkdown and/or Jupyter Notebooks for communicating reproducible results; and the ability to also condense, summarize, and synthesize those results into informative and actionable presentations to less technical audiences. Strong personal project management skills with significant practical experience managing your time split between multiple, parallel projects; experience with Agile processes and frameworks for team collaboration (e.g. Kanban, Trello, Atlassian tools) ', ' Work with data scientists, researchers, product teams, and other domain experts to build solutions to complex data-oriented problems Organize, mine, explore, and interpret laboratory assay and ‘omics datasets from multiple sources under multiple conditions (e.g. internal, CRO, publication, consortium, and patent data) Train, assess, deploy, and interpret statistical machine learning models that inform, derisk, and advance our programs. ', 'Work with data scientists, researchers, product teams, and other domain experts to build solutions to complex data-oriented problems']

", "You've used Rails and React before.", 'Responsibilities', ' Ruby/Rails React, JavaScript, TypeScript, d3 AWS, Heroku PostgreSQL, Redis ', 'Nice-to-Haves', 'Comfort with ambiguity. You constantly ask yourself what your top priorities are and if you’re supporting the overall goals of the company. When things are not certain, you’re not shy about asking for help. Architect an infrastructure that can scale with our business. Facilitate data science work both internally at Hummingbird and for our customers. experience building and maintaining ETL pipelines', 'Personal Capital is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a diverse workforce.\xa0\xa0', 'Continuously improve quality, efficiency, and scalability of data pipelines\xa0', 'You are self-motivated, self-directed, and have hands-on experience with all aspects of the software development lifecycle, from design to deployment. You have a deep understanding of the full life data lifecycle and the role that high-quality data plays across applications, machine learning, business analytics, and reporting. Strong candidates will exhibit solid critical thinking skills, the ability to synthesize complex problems, and a talent for transforming data to create solutions that add value to a myriad of business requirements. You have the demonstrated ability to facilitate and take ownership of assigned technical projects in a fast-paced environment. Excellent written and speaking communication skills are required as we work together in a collaborative cross-functional environment and interact with the full spectrum of business divisions.', '3+ years of Python development experience', 'Experience with AWS integrations such as Kinesis, Firehose, Aurora Unload, Redshift, Spectrum, Elastic Mapreduce, SageMaker and Lambda', 'Personal Capital is a leading digital wealth management company, founded in 2009. We’re on a mission to transform financial lives through technology and people, providing both insight-driven advice with free financial tools and personalized wealth management from 200+ registered financial advisors across the country. Personal Capital has raised $315 million in capital from accomplished financial and strategic investors (IVP, Venrock, Crosslink, Corsair, Blackrock, BBVA, USAA, IGM/Power) to disrupt the traditional $30 trillion U.S. wealth management market. Our free personal finance app is utilized by over two million users, helping them track over $840 billion of their personal finances, all in one place. Our award-winning apps paved the way for our advisory firm, which now manages over $12 billion in personalized investment portfolios for American families. Personal Capital is headquartered in Redwood Shores with offices in San Francisco, Denver, Dallas and Atlanta.', 'The Candidate:', 'You will play a critical role on the Data and Analytics team, responsible for transforming data from disparate systems to provide insights and analytics for business stakeholders. You’ll leverage cloud-based infrastructure to implement technology solutions that are scalable, resilient, and efficient. You will collaborate with Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, DBAs, cross-functional teams, and business partners. You will architect, design, implement and operate data engineering solutions, using Agile methodology, that empower users to make informed business decisions.', 'The Company:', '\xa0', 'Experience with API code integrations with external vendors to push/pull data between organizations\xa0', 'At least 7 years of post-degree professional experience, including:', 'Qualifications:', 'Familiarity with data orchestration pipeline using Argo or Airflow', 'Knowledge of analytic tools such as R, Tableau, Plotly, Python Pandas', 'Proficiency with the design and execution of NoSQL database to optimize BigData storage and retrieval\xa0', 'Financial services industry experience is a plus', 'Deep understanding of writing test cases to ensure data quality, reliability and high level of confidence']

To learn more, go to\xa0www.characterlab.org.', 'Character Lab has a Remote-First policy, which means that we fully support employees working remotely from any US location. ['Use engineering best practices to ensure security and privacy compliance across all development projects.', 'Responsibilities', 'Job Title', "Bachelor's degree in technology related field or relevant experience4+ years of MS SQL or T-SQL experience, including writing, troubleshooting, optimizing, etc.4+ years of industry experience in Data Engineering, BI Engineer, or related field with experience manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets4+ years of industry experience in Data Presentation & Visualization using PowerBI, Tableau, Reporting Services, or similar reporting softwareExperience with agile and scrum software development methodologiesHands-on experience with Azure Cloud Services (Data Factory, Data Explorer, HDInsight, Cosmos DB, SQL) or equivalentExperience with data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ELT, and reporting/analytics toolsExperience optimizing code for hardened, efficient deployments", 'Experience optimizing code for hardened, efficient deployments', 'Hands-on experience with Azure Cloud Services (Data Factory, Data Explorer, HDInsight, Cosmos DB, SQL) or equivalent', 'Collaborate and communicate with architects and engineers to optimize data flows, tools, operational costs, and reporting infrastructures.', '4+ years of industry experience in Data Presentation & Visualization using PowerBI, Tableau, Reporting Services, or similar reporting software', '4+ years of MS SQL or T-SQL experience, including writing, troubleshooting, optimizing, etc.', 'Work with business stakeholders and Product team to understand requirements and translate to technical requirements.', 'Mentor and develop other team members.', 'Help design, architect, and support high quality data frameworks.', 'The Senior Data Engineer is a member of an Agile-oriented team of software engineers, business analysts, software testers, technical writers and UX designers who leverage software to solve real-world problems in the event planning industry. The Senior Data Engineer actively develops new reports for stakeholders and maintains existing reports with a high degree of quality and attention to detail. They build and maintains ETL processes and build data structures and warehouses to accommodate data needs for the company.  The Senior Data Engineer works with business and product analysts to determine reporting requirements and how to best to derive the intended outcome; with architecture to inform data frameworks, including accuracy of data, performance, and scaling; with dev team to determine inclusion of reporting technical requirements; with quality assurance to ensure reports are accurate and representative of stakeholder requirements.', 'Job Overview', 'Experience with agile and scrum software development methodologies', 'Senior Data Engineer', 'Help build data marts for different use cases across the business, using Microsoft and other big data technologies.', 'Work with business stakeholders and Product team to understand requirements and translate to technical requirements.Build and maintain reports on existing reporting infrastructure (PowerBI, Tableau), while helping evolve solution based on stakeholder needs.Help design, architect, and support high quality data frameworks.Collaborate and communicate with architects and engineers to optimize data flows, tools, operational costs, and reporting infrastructures.Use engineering best practices to ensure security and privacy compliance across all development projects.Help build data marts for different use cases across the business, using Microsoft and other big data technologies.Mentor and develop other team members.', 'Requirements', 'Experience with data warehouse technical architectures, ETL/ELT, and reporting/analytics tools', 'Build and maintain reports on existing reporting infrastructure (PowerBI, Tableau), while helping evolve solution based on stakeholder needs.', "Bachelor's degree in technology related field or relevant experience", '4+ years of industry experience in Data Engineering, BI Engineer, or related field with experience manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets']

job_title: AWS Data Engineer with Data Lakes
job_text: ['', 'Benefits:', 'Candidates should e-mail resume to nirmal.raj@htcinc.com and call me at 248-308-1527', 'Experience with Infrastructure as code tools like Terraform, AWS cloud formation.', 'Implementation of AWS Cloud Data Lake and viewing Data ingestion to AWS Data Lake.Build Enterprise Data Lake on AWS Cloud.Develop Data Lake for reporting in Redshift.Background in Python for creating Alerts is required.Deployed Data-lakes at scale in AWS using AWS Lake Formation.Aware of Lake formation access models, IAM principles, best practices on cross-account access patterns.Worked on Data lake monitoring using tools like CloudWatch/cloud trail/Lambda.Extensive experience on S3 storage models, S3 access, configuration, AWS config.Experience in both EC2 and serverless computing on AWS.Experience with Infrastructure as code tools like Terraform, AWS cloud formation.Experience in reporting tools using AWS QuickSight.Good background in Python.', 'Build Enterprise Data Lake on AWS Cloud.', 'EEO/M/F/V/H', 'Project Details:', 'Extensive experience on S3 storage models, S3 access, configuration, AWS config.', 'About the Job', 'Good background in Python.', 'AWS Data Engineer with Data Lakes', 'Aware of Lake formation access models, IAM principles, best practices on cross-account access patterns.', 'Experience in both EC2 and serverless computing on AWS.', 'Deployed Data-lakes at scale in AWS using AWS Lake Formation.', 'HTC*s competitive package includes besides compensation Health, Dental, Vision, Disability Cover, both Short and Long term, Life Insurance, Flexible Spending, 401k, and Paid Vacation', 'Project Details:\xa0', 'Background in Python for creating Alerts is required.', 'Experience in reporting tools using AWS QuickSight.', 'Worked on Data lake monitoring using tools like CloudWatch/cloud trail/Lambda.', 'We are currently looking for an AWS Data Engineer with Data Lakes. We will consider relocation for candidates with exceptional skills.', 'Benefits', 'Implementation of AWS Cloud Data Lake and viewing Data ingestion to AWS Data Lake.', 'Develop Data Lake for reporting in Redshift.', 'Be sure to reference the job number and title in the subject line. A relevant degree or its foreign equivalent is required.']

Design the extract, transform and load data warehouse solutions, lead system and integration testing and define standards and architecture. Collaborate with Business Analysts, Data Modelers, SMEs and Data governance liaisons to achieve a very good understanding of metadata and data quality requirements and then design and develop sustainable ETL applications to address those requirements. Establish and oversee ETL change management procedures. Develop strategies, policies, processes, and best practices. Manage and mentor a scrum team of SQL and ETL developers. ', 'Manage and mentor a scrum team of SQL and ETL developers.', 'Strong communication skills with an excellent track record of working with scrum teams.', '7+ years in an ETL Delivery Role for a leading enterprise toolset, 5+ years of Data Warehouse delivery experience and 3+ years in a Senior Informatica (IICS) ETL Role.', 'Cloud Based ETL experience', ' 7+ years in an ETL Delivery Role for a leading enterprise toolset, 5+ years of Data Warehouse delivery experience and 3+ years in a Senior Informatica (IICS) ETL Role. Strong SQL knowledge of a leading DBMS (Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server) Experience with Cloud implementation or migration a plus (Azure, AWS) Extensive knowledge of the Informatica Cloud (IICS) tool implementation, maintenance, security and tuning to include enterprise capabilities. Extensive knowledge of the latest version of Informatica Cloud (IICS). Deep knowledge in Data Integration, Data Quality, Metadata Management and understanding of data warehouse objectives with a leading ETL Tool. Well versed in data warehouse development and ability to implement dimensional model design patterns to include slowly changing dimensions (SCD) and multiple fact table strategies to meet end user reporting requirements. Ability to prioritize and manage a complex and changing workload. Strong communication skills with an excellent track record of working with scrum teams. Mortgage or Financial Services experience a plus ']

We are literally keeping people out of the hospital. We are changing lives.', 'Experience with distributed systems (Kafka, Casandra, Elasticsearch, etc)', 'PhysIQ is looking for a Cloud Data Engineer who can help us reinforce our existing ecosystem of cloud technologies (including Kubernetes, Apache Flink, Cassandra, MySQL, etc.) to maintain our stable foundation of modern tools and solutions in order to continue to meet our customer and business needs. A great Cloud Engineer will find a balance between regular feature work, cross-team collaboration, and advocacy and leadership for improvement efforts when he or she identifies them. It should be no surprise that quality is a central focus to us as a company devoted to managing and helping improve peoples’ health.', 'PhysIQ is a transformational leader in applying highly sophisticated technology to solve some of the most pressing problems in healthcare. More specifically, we are forging the frontier of healthcare delivery at the intersection of mobile technology and artificial intelligence.\xa0With the\xa0unprecedented challenges presented by the COVID-19 crisis, there has never been a time of more apparent need for that intersection. Our team is working rapidly to apply our innovative solutions to the changing circumstances of the “new normal” our world now faces. We are extremely proud to be on the cutting edge of problem solving as our current healthcare systems are being stretched to their utmost limits.', 'Experience working in a fast-paced, high-tech environment (preferably software development) and comfortable navigating conflicting priorities and ambiguous problems', '\xa0', '4-year technical degree (Computer Science or Engineering)5+ years of professional software development experience5-10 years of software engineering to include Java, Scala, and PythonAbility to work with broad parameters in complex situationsExperience with Hadoop, MapReduce, Spark, Flink and/or other Big Data processing platforms.Experience with Agile development, continuous integration, and continuous deliveryDemonstrated leadership capabilities with the ability to work across functional boundariesExperience with distributed systems (Kafka, Casandra, Elasticsearch, etc)Experience working in a fast-paced, high-tech environment (preferably software development) and comfortable navigating conflicting priorities and ambiguous problemsTop notch organizational skills and ability to manage multiple projects in a changeful environmentConfidence in being a self-starter with excellent oral and communication skills', 'Experience with Kotlin', 'With the\xa0', 'Experience with a major cloud platform, such as AWS or GCE', 'Our core values are simple and are defined by integrity, passion and relentless drive toward solving the impossible.', 'Our core values are simple and are defined by integrity, passion and relentless drive toward solving the impossible.We are a team in its purest definition. We all pull on the rope together, in the same direction, with the same intensity.Our customers and their patients depend on us to deliver technology that will forever change healthcare. We are literally keeping people out of the hospital. We are changing lives.']

['', 'You’ll Spend Time On The Following', 'You have a track record of innovation and expertise in Data Engineering ', 'Provide technical leadership in an enterprise environment to ensure delivery of exceptional technical solutions.', 'You are comfortable applying data security strategy to solve business problems', 'contact me about recruitment opportunities"', 'Be an inspiration for innovation to the client.', 'Ensure technical expectations of deliverables are met.', 'While we’ve traditionally been a traveling consultancy, travel is not required for this role at the moment. We anticipate the need for travel to our client locations in the future when it’s deemed safe.', 'Collaborate with other Data Engineer Anchors in the org to learn and share best practices and techniques', 'Quickly gain an understanding of the landscape of tools and data frameworks so as to recommend next steps, approach (such as real-time streaming, batch, workflows, etc.)', 'It is the policy of ThoughtWorks, Inc. to provide a work environment free of discrimination. The Company will take affirmative action to ensure applicants and ThoughtWorks employees are treated without regard to race, color, religion, sex/gender, national origin, ethnic origin, veteran or military status, family or marital status, disability, genetic information, age, sexual orientation, gender expression or gender identity. This also includes individuals who are perceived to have any of the aforementioned attributes. ThoughtWorks will adhere to all federal, state, and municipal laws and regulations governing employment.', 'You’re passionate about craftsmanship and have applied your expertise across a range of industries and organizations', 'Candidates must possess work authorization that does not require H-1B visa sponsorship by ThoughtWorks or dependent EAD.', 'Hands-on experience building Data Engineering tooling with the Microsoft Azure Data Engineering and Analytics stacks including ADLS, Azure Synapse Analytics, Polybase, ADF, Azure Event Hub, Azure Databricks, Active Directory, and PowerBI. ['', '6-8 years of experience in in a data engineering role or related specialty with demonstrated ability in data modeling2+ years Data engineering experience on the Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), or SnowflakeExperience using Extract, Transformation and Load (ETL) tools with Informatica (IICS) to build automated data pipelinesExperience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++', 'Design and build dimensional data models to support the data warehouse initiatives.', 'Collaborate with data architects and modelers on data store designs and best practices', 'Eliassen Group is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.', 'Job ID: 346934', 'About Eliassen Group:', 'Requirements:', 'Collaborate with business partners to productionize, optimize, and scale enterprise analytics.', 'Assemble large, complex data sets that meet the analytical needs of the data scientist teams.', 'Participate in requirements gathering sessions to distill technical requirements from business requests.', 'Assess new data sources to better understand availability and quality of data.', '\xa0As part of an agile team, design, develop and maintain an optimal data pipeline architecture using both structured data sources and big data for both on-premise and cloud-based environments.Develop and automate ETL code using scripting languages, ETL tools and job scheduling software to support all reporting and analytical data needs.Design and build dimensional data models to support the data warehouse initiatives.Assemble large, complex data sets that meet the analytical needs of the data scientist teams.Assess new data sources to better understand availability and quality of data.Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data pipeline performance, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability and access to information.Participate in requirements gathering sessions to distill technical requirements from business requests.Collaborate with business partners to productionize, optimize, and scale enterprise analytics.Collaborate with data architects and modelers on data store designs and best practicesProvide off-hours support for all developed data pipelines in an on-call rotation.', 'Don’t miss out on our referral program! If we hire a candidate that you refer us to then you can be eligible for a\xa0$1,000 referral check!', 'Responsibilities:', 'We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Big Data Engineer with our industry-leading client in Canonsburg, PA.\xa0The Sr. Big Data Engineer manages the uninterrupted flow of information by designing and maintaining data pipelines to deliver data across our organization. S/he builds the automated data pipelines to ingest and prepare the data to meet the reporting and analytics needs of the organization. This includes building and maintaining the data structures and architectures for data ingestion, processing and deployment for large-scale, data-intensive applications. This individual must ensure that optimal ETL (Extract, Transformation, and Load) solutions are developed by applying best practices to the data modeling, code development and automation.', 'Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data pipeline performance, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability and access to information.', 'This is a full-time, permanent opportunity, offering a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package', 'Eliassen Group provides strategic talent solutions to drive our clients’ innovation and business results. Leveraging over 30 years of success, our expertise in IT staffing, Agile consulting, creative services, managed services, and life sciences enables us to partner with our clients to execute their business strategy and scale effectively. Headquartered in Reading, MA and with offices from coast to coast, Eliassen Group offers local community presence, deep networks, as well as national reach. For more information, visit http://www.eliassen.com.', '\xa0$1,000 referral check!', 'Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, Java, C++', '6-8 years of experience in in a data engineering role or related specialty with demonstrated ability in data modeling', 'Provide off-hours support for all developed data pipelines in an on-call rotation.', '\xa0As part of an agile team, design, develop and maintain an optimal data pipeline architecture using both structured data sources and big data for both on-premise and cloud-based environments.', 'Experience using Extract, Transformation and Load (ETL) tools with Informatica (IICS) to build automated data pipelines', 'Develop and automate ETL code using scripting languages, ETL tools and job scheduling software to support all reporting and analytical data needs.', '2+ years Data engineering experience on the Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Snowflake']

['The mission of the Allen Institute for Immunology is to advance the fundamental understanding of human immunology through the study of immune health and diseases where excessive or impaired immune responses drive pathological processes. We will employ a multi-disciplinary team approach in collaboration with academic centers of human immunology to generate novel mechanistic insights into the immune synapse in health and in diseases such as autoimmunity or oncology. We\xa0will simultaneously provide a foundational data set and tools for future immunological research as well as a novel collaboration portal for the broader scientific community.', 'Manipulation of mammalian cell gene expression through CRISPR/TALENS/Lentiviral transduction, including validation assays\xa0e.g. qPCR; western blotting; genotyping', 'Exceptional oral and written communication skills in a cross-functional environment', 'Research Associate III: Minimum 4 years\xa0of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated success', 'May need to work outside of standard working hours at times', 'Protein chemistry including conjugation approaches', 'Working in a laboratory', 'Effectively communicate the results as part of troubleshooting and project management', 'Essential Functions', "Bachelor's degree in immunology or related discipline (biochemistry, molecular biology, etc.) with emphasis in immunologyResearch Associate II: Minimum 2 years of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated successResearch Associate III: Minimum 4 years\xa0of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated successSenior Research Associate: Minimum 6 years\xa0of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated successExperience with plasmid construct design: PCR; restriction digest; cloning; Gibson assembly; sequencingManipulation of mammalian cell gene expression through CRISPR/TALENS/Lentiviral transduction, including validation assays\xa0e.g. qPCR; western blotting; genotypingProtein production from bacterial and mammalian cultures at small and large scale, including the use of FPLC systemsHigh attention to detail and excellent record keeping skills with the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneouslyExceptional oral and written communication skills in a cross-functional environment", 'The Allen Institute offers exceptional working conditions, and nurtures diversity and team-science in an intellectually rich and stimulating setting. We provide a highly collaborative research environment offering the opportunity to interface closely with our molecular biologists, bioinformaticians, computer scientists, and partner institutions. Everything we do begins with patients who are living with and suffering from immune disorders. We believe that by unlocking the mysteries of the human immune system, we can make a significant improvement in patients’ health and wellbeing. Together we will unravel key mechanistic pathways of the human immune system across autoimmune disease and cancer. For further details about the Institute’s research plans and partners:\xa0https://alleninstitute.org/what-we-do/immunology/', 'High attention to detail and excellent record keeping skills with the ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously', 'Experience in mass-spectrometry and the resulting data analysisHigh throughput screens (e.g. yeast two hybrid, phage display, reporter screens)Able to work independently as well as in a collaborative fast-paced environmentStrong reputation for working within a team to bring projects to completionEffectively communicate the results as part of troubleshooting and project managementExperience of antibody production and validationProtein chemistry including conjugation approaches', 'Research Associate - Molecular Immunology and Proteomics', 'Working in a laboratoryWorking at a computer and using a mouse for extended periods of timeMay need to work outside of standard working hours at times', 'Experience with plasmid construct design: PCR; restriction digest; cloning; Gibson assembly; sequencing', 'The ability to function in a team and to effectively communicate within that team to bring projects to completion on a timeline\xa0', 'RA II: 2 to 5 years of relevant experience', 'Working at a computer and using a mouse for extended periods of time', 'Experience of antibody production and validation', 'High throughput screens (e.g. yeast two hybrid, phage display, reporter screens)', 'The mission of the Allen Institute is to unlock the complexities of bioscience and advance our knowledge to improve human health. Using an open science, multi-scale, team-oriented approach, the Allen Institute focuses on accelerating foundational research, developing standards and models, and cultivating new ideas to make a broad, transformational impact on science.', 'Additional Comments', "Bachelor's degree in immunology or related discipline (biochemistry, molecular biology, etc.) with emphasis in immunology", 'Research Associate II: Minimum 2 years of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated success', 'Experience in mass-spectrometry and the resulting data analysis', 'Required years of experience by level:', 'Senior Research Associate: Minimum 6 years\xa0of research experience in immunology in either an academic or drug development setting with demonstrated success', 'Work in a cross-functional environment to perform validation and perturbation experiments for hypotheses generated through our cellular, molecular and proteomic pipelines to lead target discovery and validation effortsKey experimental approaches could include: (1) plasmid design and construction; (2) genetic manipulation of mammalian cells via CRISPR/TALENS/lentiviruses/dominant negative expression; (3) high throughput genetic screens; (4) protein production and validation including antigens or antibodies; (5) in vitro functional protein assaysThe ability to function in a team and to effectively communicate within that team to bring projects to completion on a timeline\xa0', 'RA I: 0 to 1 years of relevant experienceRA II: 2 to 5 years of relevant experienceRA III: 5+ years of relevant experience', 'https://alleninstitute.org/what-we-do/immunology/', 'Preferred Education and Experience', 'Strong reputation for working within a team to bring projects to completion', 'Required Education and Experience', 'It is the policy of the Allen Institute to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, the Allen Institute will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.', 'RA I: 0 to 1 years of relevant experience', 'Key experimental approaches could include: (1) plasmid design and construction; (2) genetic manipulation of mammalian cells via CRISPR/TALENS/lentiviruses/dominant negative expression; (3) high throughput genetic screens; (4) protein production and validation including antigens or antibodies; (5) in vitro functional protein assays', 'Able to work independently as well as in a collaborative fast-paced environment', 'Allen Institute for Immunology is seeking an experienced research associate to join a team focused on understanding and mapping the human immune system in health and disease leading to translational outcomes to improve patients’ lives. We are utilizing a multi-omic approach to comprehensively evaluate the immune system in the setting of autoimmunity and cancer. These approaches include high dimensional flow cytometry, single cell RNA-seq and ATAC-seq, plasma protein profiling and whole genome sequencing. Specific responsibilities will include working in a cross-functional environment to design and build constructs for genetic manipulation and protein expression as part of hypothesis testing and translational applications. Key experimental approaches could include: (1) plasmid design and construction; (2) genetic manipulation of mammalian cells via CRISPR/TALENS/lentiviruses; (3) high throughput genetic screens; (4) protein production and validation including antigens or antibodies; (5) in vitro functional protein assays. The ability to function in a team and to effectively communicate within that team to bring projects to completion on a timeline is essential. The successful candidate will have a strong knowledge base in experimental design in the context of the immune system and with demonstrated success in prioritizing experiments leading to rapid go-no-go decision points in an overall translational research program.\xa0', 'RA III: 5+ years of relevant experience', 'Work in a cross-functional environment to perform validation and perturbation experiments for hypotheses generated through our cellular, molecular and proteomic pipelines to lead target discovery and validation efforts', 'Work Environment', 'Protein production from bacterial and mammalian cultures at small and large scale, including the use of FPLC systems']

['Would you like to join an early-stage start-up and be a part of their growth?', 'Ideally, you will have 3-4 years of experience applying NLP to real-world problems. You will have strong Python programming skills and experience working with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch. ', 'You will be paid a competitive compensation package that includes equity and fully-paid healthcare, dental, and vision benefits. The company often hosts happy hours, team events, and lunches plus some high-quality swag when you join.', 'The company is currently 16 people in size and growing (they are looking to double headcount in the US). This role will be reporting directly to the CEO.', 'Check out\xa0www.bigcloud.io/jobs\xa0to see what else we’re recruiting for.', 'We’re hiring for a growing tech start-up in downtown Manhattan that is building a company search engine that helps business development professionals prospect at scale. The machine learning-driven search platform processes millions of web pages making it easy for investors and sales teams to find their next deal.', 'You will be responsible for designing, training, and deploying production NLP/ ML models to innovate the search engine. You will have the chance to work on a range of projects that include company classification, topic modeling, semantic parsing, and intent detection. You will also architect and build highly scalable, big data pipelines that enrich the company index.', "If you're interested in hearing more about this opportunity, please apply with your resume today.", 'Are you interested in search engine technology?', '\xa0', 'Are you passionate about NLP and machine learning?', 'Big Cloud is a machine learning recruiting firm. We’re lucky enough to recruit the best candidates for the most exciting companies all over the world. We try to reply to all applications, but we’re only human, for now! So, you may only hear from us if you are successful.']

['', 'Authorization to work in the U.S.', 'Most of our team is based in Chicago, but we are open to other US locations, with travel to Chicago.', 'Lead our research on investors and society – developing empirically grounded models of investor preferences and how those preferences are translated into action.', 'The Group:\xa0 The Behavioral Insights Team aims to help investors achieve their goals more effectively through original research about financial behavior. \xa0We study what works and publicize the results broadly.', 'Responsibilities', 'Publicize your results – in papers, in the media, and at conferences.\xa0', 'The Role: \xa0', 'Conduct detailed analyses of large individual-level datasets, such as the PSID.\xa0', 'Design, execute, and analyze large-scale randomized control trials to test your ideas; Morningstar interacts with millions of individuals and their advisors.', 'Experience in and enjoyment of public speaking.', 'A strong professional and/or personal interest in investing.', ' Experience and enjoyment in public speaking.', 'Professional experience measuring individual intent and developing and field-testing behavioral interventions to close the intention-action gap is strongly preferred.', 'A PhD or a Masters with appropriate professional experience. This role is particularly appropriate for someone in economics, behavioral economics, quantitative psychology, or data driven public policy, but others with these skills are welcome as well.', 'The Group', 'Morningstar is looking for a behavioral researcher to help build out a new area of research on investor preferences and behavior.\xa0 In particular, we’re interested in the role that investors currently play – and can play – in their societies. \xa0\xa0At its heart, investing directs capital towards and away from companies, changing the cost of doing business; investors thus have a broad impact beyond their own finances. For example, some investors direct their capital in intentional ways to mitigate potential climate change risks in their portfolio, while others pursue impact investing to support diversity equity and inclusion in society.', 'Lead our research on investors and society – developing empirically grounded models of investor preferences and how those preferences are translated into action.Conduct detailed analyses of large individual-level datasets, such as the PSID.\xa0Measure the preferences of investors, especially around corporate behavior.\xa0 This includes but is not limited to: the environment, diversity, and political involvement.Through both qualitative and quantitative analyses, identify potential obstacles to investors expressing those preferences in their investments and other engagements with companies.Design, execute, and analyze large-scale randomized control trials to test your ideas; Morningstar interacts with millions of individuals and their advisors.Based on your research, serve as in-house expert on investor interactions with society, understanding and expressing the opportunities we have for empowering investors and outlining their systemic consequences.\xa0Publicize your results – in papers, in the media, and at conferences.\xa0', 'Through both qualitative and quantitative analyses, identify potential obstacles to investors expressing those preferences in their investments and other engagements with companies.', 'Measure the preferences of investors, especially around corporate behavior.\xa0 This includes but is not limited to: the environment, diversity, and political involvement.', 'A PhD or a Masters with appropriate professional experience. This role is particularly appropriate for someone in economics, behavioral economics, quantitative psychology, or data driven public policy, but others with these skills are welcome as well.At least two years of experience using Python, R, STATA, (No)SQL or Matlab to analyze complex individual-level datasets (academics: yes, GRAs count).Professional experience measuring individual intent and developing and field-testing behavioral interventions to close the intention-action gap is strongly preferred.Demonstrated ability writing about behavioral research for a general audience.Experience in and enjoyment of public speaking.A strong professional and/or personal interest in investing.Authorization to work in the U.S.Demonstrated ability writing about behavioral research for a general audience. Experience and enjoyment in public speaking.A strong professional and/or personal interest in investing.', 'In this role, you’ll conduct statistical analyses and field experiments to understand this dynamic, the specific obstacles that investors face to translating preferences into action, and how to help investors overcome them.\xa0 Our goal is not to write theoretical papers – rather, we are developing practical, field-tested guidance for investors and the professionals who serve them.\xa0', 'Requirements', 'Based on your research, serve as in-house expert on investor interactions with society, understanding and expressing the opportunities we have for empowering investors and outlining their systemic consequences.\xa0', 'Demonstrated ability writing about behavioral research for a general audience.', 'The Role: \xa0Understand the interaction between investors and society, as investors formulate and express their preferences on corporate behavior, sustainability, and the economy.', 'At least two years of experience using Python, R, STATA, (No)SQL or Matlab to analyze complex individual-level datasets (academics: yes, GRAs count).']

company: Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering
job_text: ['', 'Desirable skills: ', 'Identify new external collaboration opportunities with the business development team', 'Retirement: University-funded retirement plan contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.', 'Facilities Access and Discounts', 'Advanced degree in bioinformatics, computational biology, computer science or related field.Minimum of six years’ experience with computational data analysis or related experience. Education may count towards years’ experience.', 'Wellness options', 'We are looking for an innovative data scientist with significant expertise in developing and applying machine learning approaches to problems in biology and medicine. Reporting to the Technology Translation Director, you will collaborate with Institute faculty and staff in high-risk, fundamental research and science-driven technology development. In this exciting role, you will be exposed to many different technologies in areas ranging from therapeutics and diagnostics to synthetic biology and materials science. Your goal will be to identify new product solutions and is a unique opportunity to follow your passion either at the Institute or as a future co-founder of a Wyss start-up.', 'Job Summary: ', 'Participate in envisioning and writing research proposals and reports to funding agencies, providing critical data, figures or information for grant and patent submissions', 'Proficiency in R, python, or MATLAB. Knowledge of statistical analysis methods like clustering. Fluency with creating and managing large biological databases', 'Industrial experience would be beneficial but is not required', 'Develop and apply machine learning approaches to problems and challenges in synthetic biology', 'Minimum of six years’ experience with computational data analysis or related experience. Education may count towards years’ experience.', 'Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complementary health services.', 'Demonstrated success in leading and working in cross-functional teams. Excellent documentation, analytical, communication, and interpersonal skills', 'You are a collaborative, impact-focused problem solver who wants to be part of a dynamic team dedicated to creating and commercializing novel approaches to global challenges in healthcare and sustainability. You want the freedom to explore, to push the boundaries of what is possible, to use your ambition to tackle challenging projects in a fast-paced, industry-focused environment without a lot of administrative hurdles. As an entrepreneurially-minded individual with an outgoing personality, you will combine machine learning, deep learning and big-data analysis experience with product development goals and applications in biology and medicine, and you will have the opportunity to enable and foster wide-ranging scientific collaborations with some of the world’s leading scientists, engineers, students, and fellows. You enjoy working with diverse groups of people and leveraging your own expertise to create innovations that can change the world.', 'Integrate artificial intelligence approaches with novel human emulation platforms to repurpose existing drugs, discover new therapeutics and disease\xa0biomarkers, and gain insight into physiology and disease states in diseases ranging from viral infections and cancer to radiation-induced toxicity', 'Hands on experience systems biology approaches – network inference, statistical learning, and genome-scale modeling a plus. Excellent documentation, analytical, communication, and inter-personal skills', 'About the Role: ', 'Time Off:', 'The Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University seeks a talented energetic professional for a leadership position in our Predictive Bioanalytics Initiative.', 'Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.', 'About Us:', 'Advanced degree in bioinformatics, computational biology, computer science or related field.', 'About the Role: \xa0', 'What you’ll do:', 'Medical/Dental/Vision', 'Use computational approaches to integrate results from high dimensional data sets and/or high-throughput assay types along with clinical endpoints to address problems in systems biology and medicine (e.g., help predict how the host\xa0responds to a particular infection)', 'Use computational approaches to integrate results from high dimensional data sets and/or high-throughput assay types along with clinical endpoints to address problems in systems biology and medicine (e.g., help predict how the host\xa0responds to a particular infection)Develop and apply machine learning approaches to problems and challenges in synthetic biologyIntegrate artificial intelligence approaches with novel human emulation platforms to repurpose existing drugs, discover new therapeutics and disease\xa0biomarkers, and gain insight into physiology and disease states in diseases ranging from viral infections and cancer to radiation-induced toxicityParticipate in envisioning and writing research proposals and reports to funding agencies, providing critical data, figures or information for grant and patent submissionsWrite and collaborate with faculty and other researchers on manuscripts, abstracts and other publications of research findingsIdentify new external collaboration opportunities with the business development teamManage and train\xa0others on research methodologyPresent\xa0research results at Wyss internal and external meetingsDemonstrate\xa0a commitment to diversity, inclusion, and cultural awareness through actions, interactions, and communications with others', 'Retirement', 'Manage and train\xa0others on research methodology', 'Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.', 'About You: ', 'Experience with omics data analysis - specifically transcriptomics, proteomics and metabolomics data – as well as artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches', "What you'll need: ", 'Write and collaborate with faculty and other researchers on manuscripts, abstracts and other publications of research findings', 'Facilities Access and Discounts: Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.', 'At the Wyss Institute, you’re a member of a supportive, dynamic community that is united by its shared goal of changing the world through groundbreaking technology development and commercialization. We encourage your professional growth and development through mentorship and tuition reimbursement to support continued learning, and more. We also support your physical, financial, and mental well-being through generous time off benefits, gym reimbursements, and other programs offered through Harvard. We value an inclusive and diverse workforce and believe that our differences enrich the work environment for all.\xa0', 'Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.', 'Transportation:', 'Tuition Assistance Program:', 'Why you’ll like working with us:', 'Ph.D. is strongly preferred', 'Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.', 'Present\xa0research results at Wyss internal and external meetings', 'Demonstrate\xa0a commitment to diversity, inclusion, and cultural awareness through actions, interactions, and communications with others', 'Our outstanding benefits package includes: ', 'Ph.D. is strongly preferredDemonstrated ability to see out collaborations as well as manage and mentor othersExperience with omics data analysis - specifically transcriptomics, proteomics and metabolomics data – as well as artificial intelligence and machine learning approachesProficiency in R, python, or MATLAB. Knowledge of statistical analysis methods like clustering. Fluency with creating and managing large biological databasesDemonstrated success in leading and working in cross-functional teams. Excellent documentation, analytical, communication, and interpersonal skillsHands on experience systems biology approaches – network inference, statistical learning, and genome-scale modeling a plus. Excellent documentation, analytical, communication, and inter-personal skillsIndustrial experience would be beneficial but is not required', 'Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.Retirement: University-funded retirement plan contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service.Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complementary health services.Facilities Access and Discounts: Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.', 'The Wyss Institute for Biologically Inspired Engineering at Harvard University is not a typical research organization as our goal is near-term impact. Our mission is to transform healthcare and the environment by emulating the way nature builds, and getting our innovations out of the lab and into the real world, fast. At the Wyss Institute, faculty from premier academic and clinical institutions collaborate with staff scientists and engineers, postdocs, graduate students, industry experts, business development leaders, and entrepreneurs across disciplines to produce new technologies that don’t just succeed at making it to the market – they disrupt it. We support research that universities, companies, and VC firms don’t fund because they claim it’s too risky. We prefer to use the word “challenging,” and we love challenges. For more information, visit:\xa0http://wyss.harvard.edu/', 'Demonstrated ability to see out collaborations as well as manage and mentor others', 'Desirable skills: \xa0']
